The successful candidate will have specialized knowledge in Microsoft Power BI, SQL and related Azure data services. The position will report to Manager, Business Intelligence. Main Duties Design, implement and maintain Power BI dashboards, reports, views, dataflows, data visualizations and reports to support productivity enhancements and operational efficiency Design solutions leveraging or enhancing existing data infrastructure, taking into consideration the various technical constraints, usability, maintainability and performance Ensure proper user security/authentication & authorization across the Power BI environment Proficient in making DAX queries and advanced level calculations on the data sets Develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with warehouse standards Able to integrate Power BI reports into other applications using embedded analytics like Power BI service or by API automation Should have knowledge and skills for reporting using tools such as Microsoft Power Apps, Flow, Azure and Salesforce Accounts for the accuracy of the data presented to BI users through the execution of validation processes and testing procedures Develop technical documentation and business glossary for the BI reports Monitor the Power BI system for data quality, job errors, performance issues and assist with resolution  Skills & Experience Essentials: BS / MS in Programming/Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Management Information Systems or any other related field preferred 5+ years of experience in developing business analytics solutions, focusing on effective visualization of insights 5+ years in data preparation, data gateway and data warehousing projects 5+ years of SQL development experience writing queries 3+ years of experience with Power BI, data modeling, Excel and writing DAX queries Data Fluency ?? ability to leverage data to help organization better understand performance and progress to goal(s) Self-motivated, driven individual who is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment Strong team orientation and collaborative style. Flexible demeanor and an ability to get involved in the details while maintain a wider view Strong business and technical aptitude with an attitude to solve complex problems Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail Excellent verbal and written communication Working Condition Team member will be required to overlap with U.S. hours. All qualified applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. At ServiceSource, we strive to find and grow exceptional people like you. Working at ServiceSource, you will be a part of an engaging, energetic, and entrepreneurial work environment while having the stability and influence of a nearly 20-year industry leader behind you. The Reporting Business Intelligence Analyst role will lead business decisions for customers and/or stakeholders by supporting and providing data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights and trends. Experience managing projects. Additional 4 years related experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. ??£ Strong experience with Digital forensics on host or network from malware perspective, ability to identify anomalous behavior on network or endpoint devices ??£ Experience with activities involving APT Threats - Ability to describe and recognize Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) tools, techniques, and procedures. ??£ Ability to develop or recommend analytic approaches or solutions to problems and situations for which information is incomplete or for which no precedent exists. - Skill in evaluating information for reliability, validity, and relevance, Skill in conducting non-attributable research, Skill in identifying critical target elements, to include critical target elements for the Global Payments cyber domain ??£ Ability to accurately and completely source all data used in Hunt, relevant intelligence, assessment and/or planning products - Skill in conducting research using deep web techniques, Skill in defining and characterizing all pertinent aspects of the operational environment. Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. In January 2018, we raised one of the largest Series C rounds ever in Southeast Asia and are well-positioned for our next phase of rapid growth.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Business Intelligence Team arms Ninja Van across South East Asia with the means to make data-informed decisions at every turn. This includes BI tooling and infrastructure as well as thoughtful analysis. The Head of Business Intelligence for PH will work closely with each part of the business, spanning across Operations (Delivery, Sort, First Mile, Last Mile, and Middle Mile) and Demand (Sales, Marketing, Customer Support). The mandate and scope of the team is essentially unlimited, and ranges from business metrics to analyses that ultimately become productized. Responsibilities Collaborate with teams across the company to develop metrics and optimize against them. Conduct actionable analysis and provide insights to decision makers. Support departments with reporting and dashboards. Identify and analyze trends and develop potential solutions. Collaborate with Senior Management to understand business intelligence needs, translating strategic business questions into resource/data requirements. Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Take dashboard requirements and transfer into rapidly developed prototypes and working solutions. Remain detail-oriented while working across a wide variety of projects. Collaborate with Data Analytics and Data Warehouse around data and table structures to optimize for KPI reporting. Collaborate across different functions and effectively influence senior business partners. Develop and implement Ninja??s strategy, making sure Ninja delivers delight one parcel at a time. Qualifications Must have a Degree in Computer Science, IT, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering or quantitative field. 3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence or related field. Proficient with SQL (Postgres, MySQL, Redshift, Snowflake), Python Experience using, writing and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment. Experience in business intelligence software (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, MicroStrategy) and ETL software. Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments. Ability to execute fast-paced and dynamic projects in a highly organized manner on a tight schedule. Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking paired with Intellectual curiosity and aptitude in picking up new technical skills. Strong communication and presentation skills necessary to build effective working relationships and positively influence decision making. (the ??Company?) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

Job Description: Company Description  null  Job Description ABOUT THIS JOB Responsible for project execution of Qualitative studies: setting-up, planning, coordinating with our internal Operations and coordinating with clients. He/She will also help develop the report framework, do report writing, and eventually make sound recommendations that answers the research objectives and report presentation. The typical day for this person is any of the following depending on project??s milestones: making sure that projects are running smoothly by doing the brief (Form 1) for the recruitment team, checking on the recruitment progress,, updating clients of developments, observing focused groups, taking notes/ coordinating with OPs/ attending to clients during FGDs, contributing to verbal debrief/recap at the end of the GD.. And when there is no group, this person will write the report (which take around 10 days from start to delivery) RESPONSIBILITIES Executing/managing market research projects specifically on set-up, coordinating internally and with client, report framework, report writing, make sound recommendation that answers the research objectives Observing focused group, taking note and debriefing at the end of the day Assist senior staff in delivering quality services to clients and ensure the services provided to clients are timely and precise according to client business needs and specifications and at the same time meeting the company's quality standards Assist in sales activities in conjunction with senior staff in terms of preparation of proposal and credential presentations Communicate client needs to appropriate team members Provide "in office" research, administrative and operational support to senior staff Be directly accountable for work conducted for their nominated clients in terms of analyses, etc. Ensure client service deliverables are aligned with the regional client service standards Maintain an accurate and up-to-date knowledge on research techniques and applications Integrate multiple data sources to answer business issues Perform quality checks on all recruitment and reports for alignment to request, accuracy and correctness Ensure standard operating procedures within area of responsibility are observed Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You like listening and talking to people in different walks of lives.Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You??re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through insights for a new angle. You can identify the narratives behind people??s verbal and non-verbal cues, and you??re always looking for what??s the context behind these mindset and behavior.  Qualifications Bachelor??s Degree or equivalent, Master??s Degree desirable; relevant Degree in sociology, anthropology, psychology or communication research is desirable Having at least 3+ years working in Qualitative Market Research, Ethnographic Market Research or related jobs. Diverse practical experience in different qualitative research methods (e.g. focus groups, ethnography, in-depth/expert interviews, grounded theory, projective techniques, etc.) Good communication and presentation skill Strong analytical skill, able to adapt to changes/new things, and able to work independently. An ability to demonstrate times where you have managed or worked on multiple projects. Proficient in Microsoft Powerpoint and/ or Google Slides, as well as Word and Excel/Spreadsheets Effective English communication skills in a cross-country environment Attention to detail and the ability to multitask Ability to express self or articulate ideas clearly and concisely  Additional Information ABOUT NIELSEN We??re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we??re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what??s happening now and what??s coming next for our clients. Today??s data is tomorrow??s marketplace revelation. We like to be in the middle of the action. That??s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We??re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what??s next with us at Nielsen: careers.nielsen.com Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

RELEVANT EXPERIENCE AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS At least 5 years' experience in modeling data, ETL analysis and design, including comprehensive experience in SQL programming. Proficiency in SQL programming, Oracle RDBMS, creating data models using Cognos Framework Manager, creating ETL scripts and jobs using Cognos Data Manager or similar BI tool; creating reports and analytics using Cognos Report/Analysis/Query/Metric Studios or similar BI tool. Proficiency in SQL performance analysis and tuning. Excellent oral and written communications skills. Excellent ability in systems analysis and design, and in the preparation of functional and detailed specifications documents. Extensive knowledge in analysis, design, development and implementation of BI systems using standards- and best practices-based methodologies and frameworks and in the use of associated productivity tools. Good interpersonal, communication and writing skills, and ability to promote team work.

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. In January 2018, we raised one of the largest Series C rounds ever in Southeast Asia and are well-positioned for our next phase of rapid growth.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Business Intelligence Team arms Ninja Van across South East Asia with the means to make data-informed decisions at every turn. This includes BI tooling and infrastructure as well as thoughtful analysis. The Head of Business Intelligence for PH will work closely with each part of the business, spanning across Operations (Delivery, Sort, First Mile, Last Mile, and Middle Mile) and Demand (Sales, Marketing, Customer Support). The mandate and scope of the team is essentially unlimited, and ranges from business metrics to analyses that ultimately become productized. Responsibilities Collaborate with teams across the company to develop metrics and optimize against them. Conduct actionable analysis and provide insights to decision makers. Support departments with reporting and dashboards. Identify and analyze trends and develop potential solutions. Collaborate with Senior Management to understand business intelligence needs, translating strategic business questions into resource/data requirements. Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Take dashboard requirements and transfer into rapidly developed prototypes and working solutions. Remain detail-oriented while working across a wide variety of projects. Collaborate with Data Analytics and Data Warehouse around data and table structures to optimize for KPI reporting. Collaborate across different functions and effectively influence senior business partners. Develop and implement Ninja??s strategy, making sure Ninja delivers delight one parcel at a time. Qualifications Must have a Degree in Computer Science, IT, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering or quantitative field. 3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence or related field. Proficient with SQL (Postgres, MySQL, Redshift, Snowflake), Python Experience using, writing and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment. Experience in business intelligence software (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, MicroStrategy) and ETL software. Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments. Ability to execute fast-paced and dynamic projects in a highly organized manner on a tight schedule. Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking paired with Intellectual curiosity and aptitude in picking up new technical skills. Strong communication and presentation skills necessary to build effective working relationships and positively influence decision making. (the ??Company?) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

Job Description: Company Description  null  Job Description ABOUT THIS JOB Responsible for project execution of Qualitative studies: setting-up, planning, coordinating with our internal Operations and coordinating with clients. The typical day for this person is any of the following depending on project??s milestones: making sure that projects are running smoothly by doing the brief (Form 1) for the recruitment team, checking on the recruitment progress,, updating clients of developments, observing focused groups, taking notes/ coordinating with OPs/ attending to clients during FGDs, contributing to verbal debrief/recap at the end of the GD.. And when there is no group, this person will write the report (which take around 10 days from start to delivery) RESPONSIBILITIES Executing/managing market research projects specifically on set-up, coordinating internally and with client, report framework, report writing, make sound recommendation that answers the research objectives Observing focused group, taking note and debriefing at the end of the day Assist senior staff in delivering quality services to clients and ensure the services provided to clients are timely and precise according to client business needs and specifications and at the same time meeting the company's quality standards Assist in sales activities in conjunction with senior staff in terms of preparation of proposal and credential presentations Communicate client needs to appropriate team members Provide "in office" research, administrative and operational support to senior staff Be directly accountable for work conducted for their nominated clients in terms of analyses, etc. Ensure client service deliverables are aligned with the regional client service standards Maintain an accurate and up-to-date knowledge on research techniques and applications Integrate multiple data sources to answer business issues Perform quality checks on all recruitment and reports for alignment to request, accuracy and correctness Ensure standard operating procedures within area of responsibility are observed Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You like listening and talking to people in different walks of lives.Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You??re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through insights for a new angle. Job Description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. In January 2018, we raised one of the largest Series C rounds ever in Southeast Asia and are well-positioned for our next phase of rapid growth.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as a team. Ability to work under pressure. Can adapt, prioritize, and thrive in a fast moving environment. Extremely self-motivated, organized, and responsible. Problem solver with high level of computer proficiency. Description To support the Digital Intelligence group through business systems and data analysis, business intelligence and project management, by combining analytics, marketing and information technology (database) skills Responsibilities Duty 1: MRA & Project Support Data Gathering Extracts/generates quantitative information from a single or multiple tools (Business Intelligence Tools - ie: Tableau, SQL, etc) and/or from databases using standard queries (basic coding) Communicates with resource person to get input/raw data needed for report generation Conducts research to gather qualitative information (market need, market size, ethnography, competitive product information, industry trends, and check product specifications) from internal & external sources that will be used for analysis Data Manipulation Cleans extracted data using pre-defined guidelines or instructions Formats extracted data based on expected report output (with batching capability and multiple data formatting requirements) Calculates data using available fields within the gathered information (basic math and statistics) Categorizes and segments extracted data using tools to convert data to information relevant to the report (excel, macro, database) Consolidates and combines extracted data from multiple resources using automated tools (excel, macro, database), and/or from different system tools in one single database using queries (SQL, Tableau) standardize data structure from different data sources Data Analysis Gathers and analyzes report requirements from stakeholders. Identify and provide solution to general inquiries Analyses gathered information & data using descriptive analytics (basic mathematics & comparative analysis), diagnostic analytics (root cause analysis, gap analysis), predictive and prescriptive analytics (data interpretation, data correlation & statistics) Analyzes stakeholder requirements from an existing report and provides improvement and recommendation based on customer request Evaluates objective/charter and recommends non-standard reports/ workaround based on customer requirement and/or gathered data and analysis Reporting Creates reports based on standard templates and and/or tests dynamic reports based on the designed format Conceptualizes report design contents and methodologies based from gathered data and/or analysis for static or dynamic reports Provide report recommendations and validate with stakeholders Administration Logs/Enters incidents to appropriate tool (JIRA, Web Request Form, Sharepoint, Teams) Tracks and logs customer issues Continuous Process & Innovation Identifies continuous improvement project ideas Records and reviews/assesses the improvement/innovation raised by the business unit Escalates specific issues and provides recommendation to customers to address them. Works closely with counterparts/POCs to identify loopholes and process gaps Project Initiation Attends scope reviews to learn what the project request is all about Assists project manager in gathering, analyzing and clarifying customer requirements; uses technical knowledge to gauge complexity of the request Project Planning Performs research and analysis to validate if the detailed solution is the best fit to meet the requirements Creates prototypes, mock-ups using standard project templates and tools for projects without wireframes Provides own work estimates and can negotiate turnaround time within the team Informs the project lead on changes Creates project scope and timeline for dashboards. In case of differences, negotiate with clients for dashboards Reviews and assesses prototypes in terms of relevance and application to the requirements of the customers Analyzes risk and mitigate project circumstances base on impact assessment Project Execution Writes code based on specifications defined (ie frontend and backend); Participates in cross-functional testing and peer reviews Follows set coding standards, code sharing and design guidelines of the team Shares only working codes with the teams. Reports own progress back to the project tracking tool Project Testing and Deployment Sets up UAT (informing participants, scheduling, gathering results) Implements the necessary fix or improvement for basic functionalities based on the UAT results Creates user manuals using standard templates of the team Creates test cases, finalizes and/or approves to be used during UAT Finalizes and approves the test cases to be used during UAT Reviews the objective in comparison to the actual output Create, recommends and seek approval for UAT plan (data back-up/migration, communication, cut-offs, code freeze, production server setup) Implementation Performs import/export of records and/or data for validation Create workbooks/ dashboards, modify metadata, and finally publish a completed workbook or data source to Tableau Server Duty 2: System Support and Maintenance System Maintenance Implements the basic change request (dashboard enhancements, data source modifications) Implements the minor and/or major change request (dashboard enhancements, data source modifications) Recommends improvement on change request and processes Database Maintenance Troubleshoots and fixes minor problems with the tool such as --- minor UI changes, typo errors, simple coding errors Project Maintenance Troubleshoots minor and/or major bugs/defects and assists stakeholders in making sure issues/requests are resolved appropriately and on time (minor: UI fixes, raw data requests; advanced bug/defects: loss of data, server errors, logical errors) Maintenance & Upgrades Encodes new features or changes related to the system upgrade Creates and Sends maintenance announcements to end-users Monitors data transfer and load processes Monitors errors and data inconsistencies Controlling permissions for system contents such as data sources, workbooks, and views for data security. Gathers approval and validates completeness of the requirements Provides basic technical support on issues such as user contact, issue triage, user follow-up and communication Interprets BU/ Platftorm/ WA report requirements and cascade to action owner Maintains existing system functionality and capacity as needed based on identified issues and improvements Validates new features thru testing Troubleshoots business systems/web issues and relays them to other world areas and IT Propose and Implement Preventive action to avoid issue recurrence Duty 3: Operations Support Documented Information Management Creates technical documentation/user manual, data dictionary, database schema, etc.) Updates an existing Documented Information related documents and processes (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) based on the documentation guidelines (e.g. identification, description, format) Maintains the master list of documented information (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) for completeness and accuracy Identifies and controls the storage, retention, preservation and disposal of documented information. Google Analytics, WebTrends, Brightcove) Job Type: Full-time

We are a leading chemical company, with the best teams developing intelligent solutions for our customers and for a sustainable future. Our success as a company relies on the engagement of our employees. We encourage our employees to develop their strengths, and we recognize their achievements. For you, this means a wide variety of job roles, and exciting opportunities for learning and career development.  Description Description: In the Philippines, BASF has been enabling manufacturers in various industries since 1963. Today, BASF Philippines, Inc. is a leading supplier of chemicals for industries including construction and coatings, automotive, health and nutrition, personal and home care, chemicals and plastics, and agriculture. BASF also operates an agricultural research station which conducts research, laboratory studies and field testing of novel technologies as part of BASF??s global research effort in the field of agricultural solutions. In 2018, BASF posted sales to customers in Philippines of approximately ?¦113 million and employed 95 people as of the end of the year. Further information on BASF in the Philippines is available at www.basf.com/ph.  Objective of the position: To create a sustainable and long-term product stewardship program for crop protection and address regulatory compliance issues by ensuring availability of valid licenses and product registrations  Main Areas of Responsibilities: Ensure that all Licenses-to-Operate (LTOs) and Certificates of Product Registrations (CPRs) are renewed and received on or before the date of validity to eliminate the disruption in sales and marketing activities; and are properly and securely archived. Lead submission of label expansions/extensions to support business growth by identifying future opportunities from existing products that can be registered in new crops or uses; reducing the existence of off-label usage by filing the necessary label expansions; managing bio-efficacy trials that are required during label expansions; and securing the approval of label expansion projects in the agreed realistic timeline. Create and ensure implementation of a long-term and sustainable stewardship program across all crop protection products by supporting regional and global product stewardship initiatives, and engaging regulatory agencies (Fertilizers and Pesticide Authority and Food and Drug Administration) in the dissemination of product stewardship programs. Support the Regulatory Supervisor in addressing potential label compliance issues in all crop protection products by proactively identifying and resolving possible compliance issues together with the local sales team, and regional and global regulatory teams. Provides regular market intelligence on new product registrations, label expansions and off patents of key competitors. Maintains updated regulatory information in business unit databases.  Minimum Education and Qualification Required: Bachelor's Degree in Biology, Chemistry, and Agriculture with Major in Entomology, Plant Pathology, Agronomy-Weed Science, Pharmacy or Biotechnology. With at least 1-2 years combined experience in country registration management/crop biology trials set-up (design, analysis), agronomy, horticultural field experience or pesticide regulatory affairs. Experience is the pharmaceutical industry will also be considered. Knowledgeable of science based-principles and practices, registration requirements and guidelines, agricultural experiment/trial set-up and statistical analysis and sample management. With strong planning, project management and influencing skills. Possess very good communication skills, written and verbal. Have good organizational skills, a proactive mindset, and ability to multitask and prioritize work. Demonstrate leadership, professionalism and integrity at work. Demonstrate high level of energy and maintain stable performance under pressure. Proactive, can work independently and in teams.

Synopsis of Role  Deliver various regularly occurring reporting products (i.e., Business scorecard, agent scorecard, Satisfaction Analysis, etc.), as well as the creation of ad hoc information/reporting data on time. Effectively extract various sources of information and correlate the data into insightful information and reports for high-level analysis. The Business Intelligence Analyst should be able to do this with minimum supervision and assistance. Provide recommendations that drive reporting automation that aim to keep regular and ad hoc reports preparation as efficient as possible. Efficiently communicate with reporting stakeholders to understand and deliver reporting requirements.  Essential Functions  Recommend solutions based on evaluation and personal feedback of execution  The Business Intelligence Analyst runs and analyzes reports with the result of providing insightful information to operations. They also determine focus points depending on the results of data analysis.  Specialize in Data Analysis and Management  BIA are also data specialists who contribute to organizational improvement by gathering and analyzing data, preparing reports, and introducing process improvements throughout the reporting process. They have excellent analytical and technical skills, in addition to a keen ability to determine specifications and standards for business reporting and maintaining data integrity.  Critical Skills / Competencies  Attention to detail Demonstrated analytical skills Communication proficiency Decision making Customer focus Performance accountability Contingency thinking Interpersonal understanding Flexibility Professional confidence Time Management skills Knowledge in the following is a plus: MS Powerpoint, Google Slides, Google Forms, Zendesk Insights, Snapengage Analytics  Software/Computer Skills  Must be knowledgeable and proficient in the use of Office applications for document editing, spreadsheet manipulation, and email. Extensive knowledge in the use of MS Excel or Google Spreadsheets. Highly adept in analyzing data and creating/maintaining daily/weekly/monthly reports, including knowledge of pivot tables, vlookup, conditional formatting, graphs, and linked data. Experience in Customer Relationship Management systems like ZenDesk, SalesForce or its equivalent is essential. Must be willing and able to learn a variety of software applications for use in the work environment.  Preferred Education and Experience  At least 2 to 3 years of working experience in a BPO environment is preferred.

Your Role and Responsibilities Payroll Practitioner Dispatching work requests and cases Dispatching transactions while identifying correct owners Monitoring and closing of dispatched transactions Tracking of work requests, cases and transactions received and dispatched Performing simple transactions Performing volume driven transactions Make decisions based on document business process Perform controls and peer to peer validation Compilation and processing of transactional Payroll Data. Description  What does an Executive Administration Manager really do? Think of yourself as someone who will lead in be in charge of all planning, organizing and implementing all administrative systems, so not just anyone is qualified for this role! We make sure we get the best of the best, after all, we are a ridiculously good company so we make sure our employees are top notch. So come on, now we need your full concentration because its time to imagine what its like being an Executive Administration Manager. Imagine yourself going to work with one thing on your mind: that you will ensure that the EAs/AAs are connecting with the right departments in terms of schedule, logistics and other necessary arrangements. (Restaurant, Hotel, etc). As you tackle your new tasks for the day, you know that it will lead to one thing: that you will empower the team to always strive for excellence and continuous self-improvement and foster a culture of accountability. As an Executive Administration Manager, you will be overall in charge of any executive visits in PH. You will maintain continuity of admin tasks for support and operations to ensure AAs/EAs are supporting the executives efficiently. You will assign, if needed, a specific admin assistant to an executive visitors to ensure the trip will run smoothly. You will be responsible for planning and scheduling executive visits. This includes meetings, agenda, boardroom reservations, interviews, orientations, 121s and training sessions. You will be overseeing special projects and tracking progress towards department/company goals. You will be responsible for planning and keeping track of multiple projects and deadlines in relation to the AAs/EAs. You will be overall in charge of making sure that executive visits will run smoothly and overseeing all administrative support. You will supervise the AAs/EAs to ensure maximum productivity. You will be mentoring, training and coaching the team and delegate assignments. You will manage the AAs/Team in assisting executives with Hotel Bookings/Accommodations, Flight assistance, shuttle assistance, Boardroom reservations, Restaurant reservations, Training room reservations, special events planning and the like. You will monitor and ensure that all admin related expenses of executive must be properly accounted for. Liquidation of Corp Cards, Reimbursements and other financial/admin related tasks. You will be leading, managing and planning of operational processes to support team/executives. You will be responsible with budget planning and enforcement and customer service procedures. You must be capable of becoming a project manager for special assignments/projects )Ex. Plastic-free project). You will lead the team in completing special projects by organizing and coordinating information and requirements and monitor results. You will improve programs and service quality by devising new applications; updating procedures; evaluating system results. You will maintain a top-notch group by recruiting, selecting, orienting and training Admin Assistant/Executive Assistants. Along with that, the Office Manager must communicate job expectations and standards through coaching and accountability to ensure that systems, policies, and procedures are met. So, do you have what it takes to become an Executive Administration Manager?  Requirements: So what is it were looking for? We need someone who has the capability and ability to manage, inspire and coach a team to properly guide them towards tasks and goals. We need someone with commitment to developing key talents and building future leaders. We need someone with a minimum 3 years Leadership Experience, must have experience as an Executive Assistant to high-level Executives, and a minimum of 5 years experience in office/admin management. We also need someone with extraordinary Problem Solving Skills, High level of emotional intelligence is also needed. We need someone who must have a high level of perseverance and passion. Someone who is knowledgeable with Travel, Booking and other Admin related preparations to ensure that the AAs under this person will render high-quality service/assistance. Graduate of a 4-year course preparable Administration or Management course. BPO, Corporate set up experience is a plus factor. We also need someone who has the ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of executives, managers, clients, customers, and teammates.Lastly, someone we need someone with excellent in GSuite applications and must be knowledgeable in presentations and reports. Listed as one of Glassdoors 100 Best Places to Work, USA Todays Best Company Cultures and Best Companies for Women by Comparably, TaskUs is a Frontline-First company that puts its people at the heart of everything they do. Founded in 2008 by Bryce Maddock and Jaspar Weir, the company raised over $250mm in 2018 from the worlds largest private equity firm, Blackstone. TaskUs currently has over 20,000 employees and offices across the U.S., Philippines, India, Taiwan, and Mexico. TaskUs, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. To find out more visit. Specialists in industry disruption, eWave is an independent digital transformation agency with commerce at its core. Using service design thinking, we have an unwavering commitment to delivering experience-driven digital reinvention that inspires deeper relationships between brands and their customers.  Partnering with brands such as Nike, Canon, Coca-Cola Amatil, and Nestle, we work on some of the most exciting and innovative digital projects in the APAC market.  Our team is our strongest asset, and together, we??re reimagining consumer needs using methods that bring our clients closer to their customers than ever before. We??re thinkers, we??re creatives, we??re technologists, and we??re looking for people to join us on our journey.  THE ROLE  Reporting to the Global Head of Creative, the Brand Creative Designer will champion the visual and conceptual side of our brand activities and initiatives and assure their adherence to developing the brand identity and work closely with them and key stakeholders on the brand identity of eWave and it??s products such as Quik AI (Artificial Intelligence Image Editor) and Luft (Headless Commerce Platform).  The Brand Creative Designer will be responsible for the design and management of the brand image through the creation and review of all the visual elements of the brand. You will also be responsible for designing and ensuring the look and feel is on brand of all communication elements such as: social, digital, corporate branding, sales and pre-sales activities, corporate/brand/PR events and other marketing initiatives.  You will be a creative thinker in a hands-on role with the ability to offer solutions to problems and provide recommendations based off available data as well as visually bring these to life and implement successfully delivery.  Define the brand??s strategic creative direction, together with our Global Head of Creative, CEO and Chief Marketing Officer, delivering all creative elements of the brand including marketing & communications for all channels with a heavy emphasis on eCommerce and digital Responsible for approval of the creative direction of all marketing communications and all brand Digital Asset management Accountable for leading, managing and implementing the design for the brand in line with the business strategy Identifying opportunities for improvement and realising when its time to replace content or styles across all media Have the ability to both support or lead the development of content strategy and execution accordingly Conceptualize and deliver original, compelling and resonating campaigns and launches which stand out and engage our target market, driving the demand and adoption of our market-leading products Own creative process end-to-end, including concept development, art direction, full production management and creation and delivery of final artworks in alignment with brand guidelines, project milestones and budget; act as the custodian of our brand visual identity  Your day to day tasks will include: Creating digital assets for our websites, electronic direct mail, social media Designing and executing engaging marketing campaigns Developing and growing digital design offerings to expand our marketing capabilities Creating and editing video and motion graphics Creating visual campaigns & brand identities that are distinctive, compelling and on-brand, and will ignite the demand and adoption of our products and services THE CANDIDATE 4+ years of experience in a similar role Experience in a eCommerce environment will be highly advantageous Strong interpersonal skills, coupled with effective prioritisation and time management skills will be crucial to your success Advanced Adobe Suite experience. We need to know that the suite of Adobe products and in particular; InDesign, Illustrator, Acrobat Pro, are second nature to you but Premiere Pro and After Effects is ideal Video & moving image, in general, is at of inspiring our communications these days, so we need you to be great at creating and editing video content. Engaging & consistent. The ability to create innovative brand content across all channels including; LinkedIn, Sales & Pre-Sales pitches, marketing comms, website and occasionally some print collateral as well as external events Creative & resourceful; we want you to be the kind of individual that can look at something and have think how we can be able to re purpose and refresh it, so that it may be used again but know when to retire it THE BENEFITS Remote Work opportunities with an ultra flexible working culture Professional Mentoring Program with Semi-Annual Performance Review, 360 Feedback and Individual Growth Roadmap Multiple learning opportunities and Professional Certification Programs Working as a part of a Global team in a Multicultural Environment Unlimited Paid Annual Leave (after first 12 months of employment) Gifted Birthday Leave Medical Insurance Reimbursement Rewarding Compensation Package  Dare to be different!

Market Intelligence (MI) provides critical data and insight to global asset managers, insurance companies and distributors to help them make informed, strategic decisions to manage and grow their business. Through its combination of proprietary and integrated datasets, in-depth global research and trusted executive engagement, ISS MI delivers solutions for market sizing, competitor benchmarking, product strategy and opportunity identification across a wide range of financial products including funds, annuities, insurance, mortgages, and other instruments. The ISS MI solutions include the industry-leading data platforms Simfund, BrightScope, Local Market Share, and Financial Clarity, as well a full collection of global research and analytics services including Investor Economics, Market Metrics, and Plan for Life. Description To support the Digital Intelligence group through business systems and data analysis, business intelligence and project management, by combining analytics, marketing and information technology (database) skills Responsibilities Duty 1: MRA & Project Support Data Gathering Extracts/generates quantitative information from a single or multiple tools (Business Intelligence Tools - ie: Tableau, SQL, etc) and/or from databases using standard queries (basic coding) Communicates with resource person to get input/raw data needed for report generation Conducts research to gather qualitative information (market need, market size, ethnography, competitive product information, industry trends, and check product specifications) from internal & external sources that will be used for analysis Data Manipulation Cleans extracted data using pre-defined guidelines or instructions Formats extracted data based on expected report output (with batching capability and multiple data formatting requirements) Calculates data using available fields within the gathered information (basic math and statistics) Categorizes and segments extracted data using tools to convert data to information relevant to the report (excel, macro, database) Consolidates and combines extracted data from multiple resources using automated tools (excel, macro, database), and/or from different system tools in one single database using queries (SQL, Tableau) standardize data structure from different data sources Data Analysis Gathers and analyzes report requirements from stakeholders. Identify and provide solution to general inquiries Analyses gathered information & data using descriptive analytics (basic mathematics & comparative analysis), diagnostic analytics (root cause analysis, gap analysis), predictive and prescriptive analytics (data interpretation, data correlation & statistics) Analyzes stakeholder requirements from an existing report and provides improvement and recommendation based on customer request Evaluates objective/charter and recommends non-standard reports/ workaround based on customer requirement and/or gathered data and analysis Reporting Creates reports based on standard templates and and/or tests dynamic reports based on the designed format Conceptualizes report design contents and methodologies based from gathered data and/or analysis for static or dynamic reports Provide report recommendations and validate with stakeholders Administration Logs/Enters incidents to appropriate tool (JIRA, Web Request Form, Sharepoint, Teams) Tracks and logs customer issues Continuous Process & Innovation Identifies continuous improvement project ideas Records and reviews/assesses the improvement/innovation raised by the business unit Escalates specific issues and provides recommendation to customers to address them. Works closely with counterparts/POCs to identify loopholes and process gaps Project Initiation Attends scope reviews to learn what the project request is all about Assists project manager in gathering, analyzing and clarifying customer requirements; uses technical knowledge to gauge complexity of the request Project Planning Performs research and analysis to validate if the detailed solution is the best fit to meet the requirements Creates prototypes, mock-ups using standard project templates and tools for projects without wireframes Provides own work estimates and can negotiate turnaround time within the team Informs the project lead on changes Creates project scope and timeline for dashboards. In case of differences, negotiate with clients for dashboards Reviews and assesses prototypes in terms of relevance and application to the requirements of the customers Analyzes risk and mitigate project circumstances base on impact assessment Project Execution Writes code based on specifications defined (ie frontend and backend); Participates in cross-functional testing and peer reviews Follows set coding standards, code sharing and design guidelines of the team Shares only working codes with the teams. Reports own progress back to the project tracking tool Project Testing and Deployment Sets up UAT (informing participants, scheduling, gathering results) Implements the necessary fix or improvement for basic functionalities based on the UAT results Creates user manuals using standard templates of the team Creates test cases, finalizes and/or approves to be used during UAT Finalizes and approves the test cases to be used during UAT Reviews the objective in comparison to the actual output Create, recommends and seek approval for UAT plan (data back-up/migration, communication, cut-offs, code freeze, production server setup) Implementation Performs import/export of records and/or data for validation Create workbooks/ dashboards, modify metadata, and finally publish a completed workbook or data source to Tableau Server Duty 2: System Support and Maintenance System Maintenance Implements the basic change request (dashboard enhancements, data source modifications) Implements the minor and/or major change request (dashboard enhancements, data source modifications) Recommends improvement on change request and processes Database Maintenance Troubleshoots and fixes minor problems with the tool such as --- minor UI changes, typo errors, simple coding errors Project Maintenance Troubleshoots minor and/or major bugs/defects and assists stakeholders in making sure issues/requests are resolved appropriately and on time (minor: UI fixes, raw data requests; advanced bug/defects: loss of data, server errors, logical errors) Maintenance & Upgrades Encodes new features or changes related to the system upgrade Creates and Sends maintenance announcements to end-users Monitors data transfer and load processes Monitors errors and data inconsistencies Controlling permissions for system contents such as data sources, workbooks, and views for data security. Gathers approval and validates completeness of the requirements Provides basic technical support on issues such as user contact, issue triage, user follow-up and communication Interprets BU/ Platftorm/ WA report requirements and cascade to action owner Maintains existing system functionality and capacity as needed based on identified issues and improvements Validates new features thru testing Troubleshoots business systems/web issues and relays them to other world areas and IT Propose and Implement Preventive action to avoid issue recurrence Duty 3: Operations Support Documented Information Management Creates technical documentation/user manual, data dictionary, database schema, etc.) Updates an existing Documented Information related documents and processes (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) based on the documentation guidelines (e.g. identification, description, format) Maintains the master list of documented information (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) for completeness and accuracy Identifies and controls the storage, retention, preservation and disposal of documented information. Training & Development Conducts basic and/or intermediate and comprehensive overview and awareness training on products, processes and/or business tools Required Skills - External Education: University degree (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems or similar) Job Related Experience: At least (2.5) two years' and a half relevant work experience in the IT Business Systems processes with relevant experience in data mining, manipulation, analysis and reporting Specific Knowledge: Microsoft Office Data Manipulation & Interpretation Database management/maintenance Root Cause / Gap Analysis Project Management Skills: Advanced Microsoft Excel proficiency Level 3 - Advanced Formulas, Pivot Tables & VBA Macro Oral and written communication Skills Problem Solving & Analytical Skills Presentation Skills Training Skills Project Management Skills Data Storytelling SQL Queries Tableau or other similar tools Experience with digital analytics is a plus (ex. Google Analytics, WebTrends, Brightcove) Job Type: Full-time
Data Skills - Specific: ['Tableau', 'SQL', 'excel', 'JIRA', 'Sharepoint', 'Tableau Server Duty', 'Microsoft Office Data Manipulation & Interpretation Database management/maintenance', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Pivot Tables', 'Google Analytics', 'WebTrends']

We are a leading chemical company, with the best teams developing intelligent solutions for our customers and for a sustainable future. Our success as a company relies on the engagement of our employees. We encourage our employees to develop their strengths, and we recognize their achievements. For you, this means a wide variety of job roles, and exciting opportunities for learning and career development.  Description Description: In the Philippines, BASF has been enabling manufacturers in various industries since 1963. Today, BASF Philippines, Inc. is a leading supplier of chemicals for industries including construction and coatings, automotive, health and nutrition, personal and home care, chemicals and plastics, and agriculture. BASF also operates an agricultural research station which conducts research, laboratory studies and field testing of novel technologies as part of BASF??s global research effort in the field of agricultural solutions. In 2018, BASF posted sales to customers in Philippines of approximately ?¦113 million and employed 95 people as of the end of the year. Further information on BASF in the Philippines is available at www.basf.com/ph.  Objective of the position: To create a sustainable and long-term product stewardship program for crop protection and address regulatory compliance issues by ensuring availability of valid licenses and product registrations  Main Areas of Responsibilities: Ensure that all Licenses-to-Operate (LTOs) and Certificates of Product Registrations (CPRs) are renewed and received on or before the date of validity to eliminate the disruption in sales and marketing activities; and are properly and securely archived. Lead submission of label expansions/extensions to support business growth by identifying future opportunities from existing products that can be registered in new crops or uses; reducing the existence of off-label usage by filing the necessary label expansions; managing bio-efficacy trials that are required during label expansions; and securing the approval of label expansion projects in the agreed realistic timeline. Create and ensure implementation of a long-term and sustainable stewardship program across all crop protection products by supporting regional and global product stewardship initiatives, and engaging regulatory agencies (Fertilizers and Pesticide Authority and Food and Drug Administration) in the dissemination of product stewardship programs. Support the Regulatory Supervisor in addressing potential label compliance issues in all crop protection products by proactively identifying and resolving possible compliance issues together with the local sales team, and regional and global regulatory teams. Provides regular market intelligence on new product registrations, label expansions and off patents of key competitors. Support the Regulatory Supervisor in providing expert advice and assistance to the Agro-Research Station on their Experimental User Permit (EUP) submissions, and license-renewal of the Shipment Hub by liaising with regulatory agencies (i.e., FPA, FDA, BAFS and BPI). Act as an alternate company representative to external meetings/fora particularly in the Technical & Regulatory (T&R), and Environmental Science Committees of Crop Life Philippines (CLP). Maintains updated regulatory information in business unit databases.  Minimum Education and Qualification Required: Bachelor's Degree in Biology, Chemistry, and Agriculture with Major in Entomology, Plant Pathology, Agronomy-Weed Science, Pharmacy or Biotechnology. With at least 1-2 years combined experience in country registration management/crop biology trials set-up (design, analysis), agronomy, horticultural field experience or pesticide regulatory affairs. Experience is the pharmaceutical industry will also be considered. Knowledgeable of science based-principles and practices, registration requirements and guidelines, agricultural experiment/trial set-up and statistical analysis and sample management. With strong planning, project management and influencing skills. Possess very good communication skills, written and verbal. Have good organizational skills, a proactive mindset, and ability to multitask and prioritize work. Demonstrate leadership, professionalism and integrity at work. Demonstrate high level of energy and maintain stable performance under pressure. Proactive, can work independently and in teams.

Working in cybersecurity takes passion for technology, speed, a desire to learn, and vigilance in order to keep every asset safe. You'll be on the front lines of innovation, working with a highly motivated team focused on analyzing, designing, developing and delivering solutions built to stop adversaries and strengthen our operations. Your research and work will ensure stability, capacity, and resiliency of our products. Working with your internal team, as well as technologists and innovators across our global network, your ability to identify threats, provide intelligent analysis, and positive actions will stop crimes and strengthen our data. Cybersecurity Intelligence Group (CIG) holds the global mandate for JPMorgan Chase's cyber intelligence collection, analysis, and dissemination of finished products to JPMorgan Chase's population of security operations teams, information technology teams, lines of business and overall executive decision makers. CIG plays an integral role in the intelligence driven defense of JPMC. This team is responsible for external engagement with peer groups and information security circles regarding cyber threats, to address events such as intrusions, malware, DDoS, unauthorized access, insider attacks and loss of proprietary information. This includes developing a deep understanding of global threat actors. As a CIG Analyst, you will work closely with the senior analysts in the team and with partners across Cybersecurity Operations to provide intelligence support on investigations. You will build a thorough understanding of Global Cybersecurity and Technology Controls (CTC) at the firm in order to provide high impact intelligence to protect the firm. You are expected to possess qualities such as a sharp intellect, an eye for detail, a high analytical capability and a good technical/cyber underpinning. An interest in cyber, current affairs and technology is essential. Prior experience in investment banking, asset management, consumer and/or commercial banking, will put you at a distinct advantage. The responsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following: Conduct deep-dive intelligence analysis of suspicious activities and attempted attacks. Contribute to CIG Reports, providing detailed analysis on cyber events, including relevant political, economic and geopolitical variables. Provide a forward-looking view of the threat, predicting shifts in adversarial intent, goals and strategic objectives. Collaborate with peer cyber operations teams to understand events and support analysis of malicious cybersecurity incidents. Track potential threats associated with attempted intrusions, network & host-based attacks, and coordinate incident response efforts with cybersecurity teams. Maintain detailed threat actor profiles on adversaries of interest/relevance to the firm, covering tactics, techniques and procedures, intent, goals and strategic objectives. Maintain knowledge of the threat landscape by monitoring open and closed intelligence sources and contribute to quarterly threat landscape briefings. Contribute to regular written and verbal briefings and presentations for Global CTC partners and Lines of Businesses. Contribute from the cybersecurity perspective to discussions and decisions regarding JPMC global technology infrastructure and technology deployments.  The candidate will also need to learn to use of one or more High Security Access (HSA) systems. Users of these systems are subject to enhanced screening, which includes both criminal and credit background checks, and/or other enhanced screening at the time of accepting the position and on an annual basis thereafter. The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Strong demonstrated knowledge of Cybersecurity and an understanding of the principles of intelligence analysis. Excellent understanding of networking concepts and Information Security, including emerging threats and attack methodologies. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to collaborate with high-performing Agile teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish goals. Proficiency in the use of skills tools, staying current with skills, participating in multiple forums. Ability to analyze vulnerabilities, threats, designs, procedures and architectural design, producing reports and sharing intelligence.  Highly Desired: Intelligence Community experience and/or experience at an international institution conducting cyber or security/intelligence related work. Coding (scripting) experience e.g. Perl, VB Script, Python etc. Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools, Threat Intelligence platform/tools, etc. Working knowledge of global threats to international cyber security, and conversant in the tactics, techniques and procedures used by cyber adversaries. Professional working proficiency in one or more of the following languages: Russian, Mandarin, Spanish. Financial sector experience. Foundational knowledge of cybersecurity organization practices, operations, risk management processes, principles, architectural requirements, engineering and threats and vulnerabilities, including incident response methodologies is preferable. Foundational knowledge of: computer forensics; legal, government and jurisprudence as they relate to cybersecurity; operating systems; and methods for intelligence gathering and sharing is preferable. Foundational knowledge of: cloud computing, computer network defense, external organizations and academic institutions dealing with cybersecurity issues, financial authorities and regulations, identity management, incident management, information assurance, information management, information systems and network security and infrastructure design is preferable. Job Title: AWS APJ Next Gen Internship Program ?? Singapore (January to...
Job Description: Penultimate year student working towards a bachelor??s or master??s degree Candidates must be able to legally work in Singapore Able to commit to a full-time internship from January to June 2021 Analytical and quantitative skills, with the ability to use Excel or other software to provide data to support analyses Excellent English written and verbal communication skills  At Amazon, our mission is to be the earth??s most customer-centric company. To achieve this, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is continuously evolving, and is a place where motivated employees thrive, and where employee ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results.  Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon company, is the world??s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. Millions of customers - including the fastest growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies - trust AWS to power their infrastructure. Founded in 2006, AWS offers over 175 fully featured services for compute, storage, databases, networking, analytics, robotics, machine learning, artificial intelligence, Internet of Things, mobile, security, hybrid, virtual reality, augmented reality, media, and application development, deployment, and management from 77 availability zones within 24 geographic regions, spanning the globe.  AWS APJ Next Gen Internship Program ?? Singapore  The AWS APJ teams are looking to hire and develop the next generation of leaders for our organization. We are seeking talented and enthusiastic students who are passionate about solving business problems, innovating and building new processes, and leading high-impact initiatives. The Next Gen Internship Program allows you to gain exposure to the AWS business and our unique Amazonian culture through a rewarding learning experience. For this six months internship (January to June 2021), interns will be based in our Singapore office, and will be assigned to one of the following teams.  1. Sales 2. Channels and Alliances  Subject to the business?? needs, a limited number of opportunities are available in the following teams.  3. Business Development 4. Sales Strategy, Operations & Enablement  As an intern, you will independently own a key business project that can drive business value, and tasks to support your assigned team. You will hone your leadership and presentation skills, and apply your creativity to innovate for our business. At the end of your internship, all interns will present their project learnings and proposal to a panel of key business leaders.  Join us! It is as simple as, ??come build the future with us.??  About the Functions:  1. Sales: The sales teams develop and execute against a territory plan to drive revenue and market share. Our sales teams work directly with customers and drive business growth by articulating compelling value propositions for AWS services, drive customer adoption of AWS, and ensure customer satisfaction. 2. Channels and Alliances: The channels and alliances team recruits, enables, and develops consulting and technology partners to drive their business growth. The AWS Partner Network (APN) is a global partner program that focuses on helping APN partners build successful AWS-based businesses or solutions by providing business, technical, marketing, and go-to-market support. Our consulting partners are professional services firms that help customers design, architect, and migrate their workloads and applications on AWS. Our technology partners provide software solutions that are hosted or integrated on the AWS platform. 3. Business Development: The business development team incubates business initiatives with an impact that will shape how the business will look like in the next 5 to 10 years. The team creates go-to-market strategies for identified business opportunities, and collaborates with other functions to implement these strategies to accelerate customer adoption of AWS. 4. Sales Strategy, Operations, and Enablement (SSOE): The SSOE team works closely with the management team to develop, implement, and manage business processes, reports and strategies that optimize business functions to meet organizational goals.  Who are we looking for?  The ideal candidate: Has business acumen, and is able to work independently and as part of a team Strong interpersonal skills required Is curious to learn, and has a ??can-do?? attitude with strong ownership Adept at problem-solving, and can come up with creative and innovative solutions Results driven with analytical capability to provide data-driven insights Able to multi-task and prioritize competing stakeholder requests Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Is comfortable working independently in a fast-paced and dynamic environment  Important Note for Application  You must attach a one page written response with your resume (saved in PDF or Microsoft Word format), and upload this as part of your application. For this one page written response (do not use bullet points), please follow the instructions below:  As written communications skills are an important aspect of the culture at Amazon, please choose and respond to one of the two questions below for your application:  1. Define innovation using anecdotal examples, and professional experiences. 2. Why is it always Day 1?  The questions are designed so that they can be interpreted in multiple ways. You must respond in narrative form (do not use bullet points). Do not include any confidential information in your responses. We will evaluate your writing based on your clarity of thought and expression, and the organization and structure of your written response.  Note: We will only consider applications with the one page written response, and uploaded together with your resume.

ZS is a professional services firm that works side by side with companies to help develop and deliver products that drive customer value and company results. From R&D to portfolio strategy, customer insights, marketing and sales strategy, operations and technology, we leverage our deep industry expertise and leading-edge analytics to create solutions that work in the real world. Our most valuable asset is our people??a fact that??s reflected in our values-driven organization in which new perspectives are integral and new ideas are celebrated. ZSers are passionately committed to helping companies and their customers thrive in industries ranging from healthcare and life sciences, to high-tech, financial services, travel and transportation, and beyond.  ZS's Business Consulting group partners with clients to design and deliver solutions to help them tackle a broad range of business challenges. Our teams work on multiple projects simultaneously, leveraging advanced data analytics and problem-solving techniques. Our recommendations and solutions are based on rigorous research and analysis underpinned by deep expertise and thought leadership. STRATEGY INSIGHTS & PLANNING ASSOCIATE Strategy Insights & Planning Associates (SIPAs) create and deliver solutions for our clients and project teams. SIPAs leverage their analytic, synthesis and communication skills to derive insights and solve business problems. In particular, SIPAs apply problem-solving frameworks to client issues, support clients in change initiatives and employ standard analytic techniques to help guide client decisions. Responsibilities: Leverage problem solving skills and frameworks to develop solutions to client business problems; Conduct market research and/or desk research to derive insights and inform client decision making; Design custom analyses using tools like Excel, Access, Confirmit and ZS's proprietary software; Synthesize and communicate results to clients and ZS teams; Collaborate with client and ZS teams to implement solutions; Take immediate responsibility for project deliverables; Drive problem solving and advance ZS??s sales+marketing capabilities. Qualifications: Bachelor's or master's degree in any discipline; strong academic performance with analytic and quantitative coursework is required (business, economics, marketing, psychology, physical or life sciences, engineering, applied mathematics, statistics or relevant fields); Up to 3 years of relevant post-collegiate job experience, preferably gathering and analyzing qualitative or quantitative data; ZS is a global consulting firm; fluency in English is required. Fluency in Korean is desirable; Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative; Effective oral and written communication skills; Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence; Strong attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset; Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks; Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, working in teams.   Candidates must possess work authorization for their intended country of employment. An on-line application, including a cover letter expressing interest and a full set of transcripts (official or unofficial), is required to be considered. ZS offers a competitive compensation package with salary and bonus incentives, plus an attractive benefits package.  NO AGENCY CALLS, PLEASE.  Connect with ZS on social media: Like ZS Careers on Facebook Follow ZS Careers on Twitter and Instagram Follow ZS on LinkedIn for more job opportunities Subscribe to the ZS YouTube channel Explore the Life at ZS blog ZS has been recognized globally for its expertise in consulting and its flexible work environment.

Job Description: Location: Singapore Type: Full-time  ROLE DESCRIPTION Homage is seeking a Business Intelligence Lead with a data-driven mentality to generate impact via Homage??s core mission of caregiving and health. The right candidate will be action and detail-oriented, recognizing that our care recipients, their loved ones and Homage??s senior management depend on your analyses to drive solution development, business growth and improve care quality.  This position will work collaboratively across multiple teams. We are looking for a candidate with a strong sense of ownership, a deep appreciation of data and fundamental understanding of end-to-end business intelligence functions, with strong crafting, structuring, communication and execution capabilities. The candidate is expected to drive the business intelligence function at Homage with a long-term vision of centering business decision-making with data as a core pillar, in a rapidly changing environment with increasing complexity.  If you want to make a huge impact at one of Singapore??s most exciting startups, learning a TON every day, we would love to hear from you.  RESPONSIBILITIES Strategise and develop the core BI reporting environment and provide holistic visibility of performance through the provisioning of self-service dashboards and reports Deliver and analyze key business performance and operating data to uncover key trends and generate business intelligence insights to drive business growth and optimisation Build the team??s capabilities to solve data challenges for the organization. You will be a hands-on people manager solving BI problems while also enabling the team through prioritization and project management Champion key data initiatives across investment, commercial and operational development, including supporting Homage??s investment and due diligence activities. Collaborate cross functionally to develop the BI framework for key actionable and functional areas, work closely with the product and engineering team on the design, development and maintenance of data models Build and maintain thorough knowledge of existing and emerging datasets and metric definitions, ensuring that they are well documented in a metric library and propagated consistently in our reporting Be the champion leading the data democratization efforts for the organization. Consistently socialise and evangelise what's in our BI ecosystem so business users can tap into existing reports Maintain knowledge on the latest updates of our BI tools so we can leverage new features or capabilities for our BI use cases  SKILLS & EXPERIENCE 3-5 years of experience working in a BI/analytics, consulting, finance or relevant field, Experience in business analysis and building analytics dashboards as well as communicating data insights to evaluate business performance Experience in gathering BI requirements and structuring specifications to produce business-relevant datasets and ensure data quality of the dataset Passion for democratizing data effectively to the wider organization for self-serve Keenness to innovate and improve the BI process beyond basic reporting, seeking ways to add value so that the organisation can consume data more effectively Strong communication skills, able to collaborate effectively with both sides of the business and technical divide A self-starter mindset who takes ownership and excels in a lean and fast-paced organisation Advanced knowledge of MS Office Suite, particularly Excel  Experience and Technical Skills (optional but bonus if you have the following): Experience working within a high-growth tech company with exposure to large amounts of operational data is a plus Data visualisation skills using Holistics, Tableau or other relevant visualisation tools. Knowledge on SQL and non-SQL (e.g. MongoDB) as well as R/Python to perform data querying, building BI models and conducting data analysis Experience with ??mazon Web Services or other cloud-based technology Understanding of ETL/ELT concepts and their relevant use cases Knowledge of analytical and statistical techniques e.g. time series, regression  ABOUT HOMAGE Homage is a care platform that combines qualified and trained caregivers, nurses, doctors and health care organisations and funders with technology, enabling care, wellness and recovery wherever you are. The work that we do and technology we build transforms lives every hour, every day. We??re looking for people who are talented, driven and motivated by our social mission.
