Join us on our exciting journey! IQVIA?? is The Human Data Science Company??, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. The Opportunity IQVIA??s Primary Intelligence team is currently recruiting for Analyst Intern positions in Singapore. The successful student applicant will have the opportunity to work with experienced healthcare consultants on integrated client solutioning to deliver comprehensive market insights & recommendations to our clients in the healthcare industry. Assignments range in complexity from research analysis, field work to assisting the development of reporting & presentation. Assignment Scope & Learning Opportunities: (Under the guidance of Senior Consultant/Engagement Leads) The role of intern will be mirroring analyst role (lesser scope) and as an assistant to Consultant. Join Us Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients. Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

Job Description: Job Responsibilities: Develops sales strategy and growth program for TopWorx Products; Switchbox (Discrete On/Off Valve Controllers & Position Feedback Monitors) and GO Switch in Asia Pacific regions. Ability to thrive in an engineering/technology-driven industry is critical. Track record of demonstrated success in sales and territory management.

Company: Agensi Pekerjaan Ellwood Consulting Sdn Bhd
Job Description: Job Description  About the client In May 2019, The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) approved the expansion of services of its Global Shared Services Unit (GSSU). With offices in Copenhagen, Kuala Lumpur and Istanbul, the GSSU services over 180 countries, 40,000 personnel and more than 40 other UN Agencies and Organizations. Through its functional lines, GSSU ensures high quality and timely delivery of human resources, financial and procurement services as well as information and innovative tools to its various clients and stakeholders. The Global Shared Services Unit (GSSU) within the Bureau for Management Services (BMS) supports all UNDP offices and units with the provision of transactional services. This includes a core set of transactions in Finance and HR that are already being handled by the Global Shared Service Unit (GSSU) in Kuala Lumpur. The GSSU is led by the Director, who reports to the Director of Bureau for Management Services (BMS). About the role The Strategic Performance (Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting) team undertakes data mining/extraction, and helps to solve financial, budgetary and related information and report generation needs, to help enable informed decision making and improve quantitative and qualitative performance, whilst ensuring that the resultant reports present a consistent and accurate view. Within this team, this role involves the formulation of reports for GSSU service lines, through data mining/extraction, standard reports and queries, and ad-hoc analysis. The role will also provide some support to the refinement of functional specifications for ERP, Business Intelligence and related system changes. The Business Analyst reports directly to the Business Specialist, Strategic Performance and Client management. Your responsibilities The Business Analyst will assist the supervisor, the Business Specialist P3 in the in the provision of financial monitoring, analysis and reporting services in respect of services clustered in GSSU. In particular the Business Analyst will undertake the following duties;  Assists the development of extracts, reports and dashboards in respect of GSSU services. Ensure that all extracts, reports, dashboards or other inputs have been appropriately tested and that data integrity is maintained with auditable corporate reports.  Assists the management and guidance of business area users in developing solutions for their reporting and information needs as well as identifying new data needs and delivery mechanisms for reporting information.  Assists to ensure system integrity through running his/her own checks and diagnostics, and through the creation of processes to run defined queries on a regular basis.  Assists the design and development of functional specifications required by GSSU and GSSU clients, through reviewing and refining functional specifications where necessary.  Assists to communicate clearly and openly with the Service delivery teams and with GSSC clients, based on facts. Ensure client priorities and constraints are well understood and supported.  Core Competencies: Innovation - Ability to make new and useful ideas work.  Leadership - Ability to persuade others to follow.  People Management - Ability to improve performance and satisfaction.  Communication - Ability to listen, adapt, persuade and transform.  Delivery - Ability to get things done while exercising good judgement.  Technical/Functional: Financial Reporting and Analysis Ability to evaluate financial data, derive relevant findings and present them in a meaningful manner.  Audit Ability to examine and verify accounts and records.  Accounting (General) Knowledge of accounting concepts, principles, regulations, and policies and ability to apply to strategic and/or practical situations.  Financial Planning and Budgeting Ability to create and manage processes to achieve UNDP's long and short-term financial goals.  Functional Technical Knowledge Firm understanding of business intelligence tools, and the architecture and design of advanced integrated management systems,preferably including PeopleSoft.  Knowledge Management Ability to efficiently handle and share information and knowledge.  Operational Efficiency Ability to identify and execute opportunities to improve operational efficiency.  Problem Solving Accurately accumulating information and its analysis; forecasting potential problems and planning; allowing for alternative, creative solutions and identifying most reasonable solutions. You will have  University Master in Finance or Accounting desirable or Professional Accounting Qualification i.e. ACCA/CPA/etc.  Up to 2 years of relevant experience in business or finance and business intelligence and analysis.  Experience in managing and supporting clients.  Experience in the usage of computers and MS Office packages.  Advanced knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages.  Experience in handling Client Relationship Management (CRM) applications or business analytics systems is desirable.  Hands-on experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), preferably with ATLAS (PeopleSoft).  Fluency in English. Knowledge of any other UN languages (French/Spanish/Arabic) is a plus.  Others: Hands-on proficiency with SQL, BI tools, Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) preferred.  Experience in production of Financial Reports and data management preferred.  Experience in handling of web-based management systems desirable. It's an interesting time for you to come on board at Vopak! Around the world, we connect the supply of and demand for vital products and resources. Energy that allows people to heat their homes and travel the world. Food for a growing planet. And chemicals for the production of various materials. Products that are vital to people??s lives. The global energy transition, the growing world population, and all new possibilities of emerging technologies and new energy sources make this a very interesting time to join our company. Business Intelligence Manager (Chemicals Team) Global Commercial & Business Development Internal applicant: Please be reminded to speak to your current manager before applying. This position is responsible for leading a team of analysts that conducts worldwide product and market research, develops opinions for commercial, sales and business development projects and undertakes management reporting. Key products to be covered are chemicals, gases, veg oil / bio fuels and base oils. Position reports to the Global Chemicals Director. Responsibilities: Undertake Research to Acquire Product and Market Intelligence Keeps abreast of market trends in chemicals, LPG/chemical Gases, veg oil and base oil products in a timely manner Examines those market trends and develops opinion on customers/products to benefit from changing market or customer conditions Understands key features of petchem complexes and clusters from a feedstock, product and derivative perspective and resulting market developments Generates and communicates market intel to all divisions in a well-timed manner through appropriate well written reporting structures. Develops and maintains relationships with key internal stakeholders to identify emerging needs and business challenges. Works with internal stakeholders across functions and time zones to enhance their strategic analysis and market and competitor intelligence. Oversees a team of two analysts who conduct similar work to support the overall targets of the Global Chemicals Product Team. Conduct Market Studies Takes lead role in scoping and conducting (or supporting) market studies for Divisions and Opcos Coordinates with internal or external parties to meet the objectives of the study scope Maintains lead role in external relationship with key chemicals / gases product consultants (eg IHSMarkit, ICIS, Nexant, Argus, WoodMac, FGH, etc). Maintains a healthy relationships with external product specialists worldwide to support the requirements of all divisions/opcos. Delivers high quality study results, which are beneficial to the company in taking decisions for commercial, business development and account management objectives Supports analysts in other divisions from a functional aspect and takes lead in their networking across the company. Initiates discussion, challenges and influences strategic management decision making and identifies opportunities for growth. Write and Manage Reporting Activities Acts as primary originator of product and market reports from a GC Team perspective supported by analysts Takes lead responsibility in developing / managing all routine and scheduled reporting activities worldwide, including EB/SB, global newsletters, divisional product information, presentations, opinions on SIP/FIP business cases, etc. Coordinates with other product analyst teams eg Oil, LNG, etc. Coordinates with other global corporate functions such as finance, corporate communications, operations and technology, new ventures, new energies, etc. Prepares written reports and presentations of findings, illustrating data graphically, and making complex matters/findings insightful. Support Business Development Activities Supports BD projects in building a business case for products and markets in scope. Conducts investigations for port and site analysis, with a view to create an opinion on the viability of the location. Assists in coordinating market intel with consultants and product specialists when needed. Supports project teams in developing write-ups for SIP/FIP or tender submissions. Translates complex findings into actionable recommendations. Requirements: Bachelor's degree (technical/engineering or business/economics); Minimum of 5-7 years commercial and business development experience in the petrochemical sector or an associated oil and gas industry, and business intelligence experience an added advantage. Knowledge of petrochemical products/markets and ability to investigate developments that lead to demand / supply changes. Skills to conduct market research, manage large data. Ability to quickly learn and develop new concepts and technologies. Positive stakeholder management capabilities with strong communication skills. Excellent writing and ability to generate detailed reports. Capability to develop own opinion on key developments, and be able to influence others. Be able to handle multiple study projects concurrently, in different products and geographies, and work the time zones effectively. Leadership to manage own team, as well as work with divisional team members, to prioritize and conduct market research effectively. What we offer: Every career at Vopak is given the opportunity to shine! When you join Vopak, you can count on: A challenging position with a high degree of responsibility in a Dutch multinational with a history over 400 years; Highly motivated colleagues; Room to grow through professional training and personal development opportunities at national and international level.

JOB SUMMARY: The Intelligence Specialist provides input and expertise on all intelligence matters including processes, support requirements, technical aspects, and operational methods. Details Essential Functions The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions. Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein. In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions. All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives. The Essential Functions Include: Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence. Conduct all source collection and research, analyze, evaluate and integrate data from multiple sources, identify intelligence gaps, and specify collection requirements, to produce assessments and recommendations. Apply highly developed inductive reasoning skills to provide a proactive approach to potential threats. Prepare analyses, assessments, or other products by applying expert judgment and specialized experience in interpreting information and making decisions. Prepare and present briefings on projects, studies and analyses to mid/high level managers. Discern patterns of complex behavior and provide accurate understanding of present and future threats. Provide analysis to guide decision makers. Provide critical front-line intelligence support to investigative and operational personnel. Extract essential information and analysis from investigations and intelligence products and synthesizes the information into actionable reports. Analyze intelligence information and other resources related to terrorist and other organized crime groups. Prepare threat assessments on upcoming major events. Identify information gaps. Develop and deliver customer specific presentations. All other duties, as assigned. Minimum Hiring Standards Additional qualifications may be specified and receive preference, depending upon the nature of the position. Must have a High School Diploma or GED. Must be willing to participate in the Company's pre-employment screening process including drug testing and background investigation. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., email, cell phone). Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private). Must have the legal right to work in the Singapore. Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English. Must be qualified in internationally recognized Chinese language proficiency test. Education/Experience Bachelor's degree in related field or a degree from a national accredited program, plus one to three years of experience in national security or criminal intelligence analysis. Competencies Able to carry out responsibilities with little or no supervision. Able to multi-task and organize workload for effective implementation. Able to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures. Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills. Serve as an effective team member. Able to adapt as the external environment and organization evolves. Effective independent judgment/decision-making ability. Strong project management skills. Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously with competing priorities and deadlines. Attentive to detail and accuracy. Able to analyze complex situations and recommend solutions. Professional demeanor and appearance. Strong client orientation and results driven. Effective follow-up skills. Computer skills; Microsoft Office. Working Conditions With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to perform effectively all essential functions. In addition to other demands, the demands of the job include: Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks, drug testing, and/or behavioral selection survey. Maintain composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff, and the public occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations. Exposure to sensitive and confidential information. Regular computer usage. Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently. Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees and/or customers. Manual dexterity required for occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment. Close and distance vision and ability to adjust focus. Frequent sitting. Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.

Job Description: The Customer Intelligence Analyst (CIA) is accountable to deliver a flawless Order to Cash (OTC) process from end-to-end to our customers. You are a problem solver who continuously improves processes and algorithms to enable touchless operations across our APAC supply chain network. You are an important link for related organizations within P&G, customers and 3rd party logistics companies to resolve any OTC issues! The scope of this CIA role requires you to support our Indonesia market operations and manage orders and documents in the written and oral Bahasa Indonesia language. Your team You will be working in the Singapore Customer Intelligence Centre (SCIC), reporting to a Cluster Manager and will be collaborating with the multifunctional teams like Finance, Sales, and Product Supply teams across Asia Pacific markets. What success looks like Using analytics and business knowledge, you are the expert in the customer order pattern, provides insights and ideas to drive end-to-end synchronization and hence bringing value for customers and P&G. You will deliver Best-in-class critical metrics including Service, Day Sales Excellent, delivery on time, and respond to customers' requests & enquiries in a timely manner. With a portfolio of trusted brands as diverse as ours, it is paramount our leaders are able to lead with courage the vast array of brands, categories and functions. We serve consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always??, Ariel??, Gillette??, Head & Shoulders??, Herbal Essences??, Oral-B??, Pampers??, Pantene??, Tampax?? and more. Our community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide. Visit http://www.pg.com to know more. Our consumers are diverse and our talents - internally - mirror this diversity to best serve it. That is why we're committed to building a winning culture based on Inclusion and our ideal candidate is passionate about the same principle: you will join our daily effort of being "in touch" so we craft brands and products to improve the lives of the world's consumers now and in the future. We want you to inspire us with your unrivaled ideas. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

Ability to thrive in an engineering/technology-driven industry is critical. Track record of demonstrated success in sales and territory management.

Job Description  About the client In May 2019, The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) approved the expansion of services of its Global Shared Services Unit (GSSU). With offices in Copenhagen, Kuala Lumpur and Istanbul, the GSSU services over 180 countries, 40,000 personnel and more than 40 other UN Agencies and Organizations. Through its functional lines, GSSU ensures high quality and timely delivery of human resources, financial and procurement services as well as information and innovative tools to its various clients and stakeholders. The Global Shared Services Unit (GSSU) within the Bureau for Management Services (BMS) supports all UNDP offices and units with the provision of transactional services. This includes a core set of transactions in Finance and HR that are already being handled by the Global Shared Service Unit (GSSU) in Kuala Lumpur. The GSSU is led by the Director, who reports to the Director of Bureau for Management Services (BMS). About the role The Strategic Performance (Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting) team undertakes data mining/extraction, and helps to solve financial, budgetary and related information and report generation needs, to help enable informed decision making and improve quantitative and qualitative performance, whilst ensuring that the resultant reports present a consistent and accurate view. Within this team, this role involves the formulation of reports for GSSU service lines, through data mining/extraction, standard reports and queries, and ad-hoc analysis. The role will also provide some support to the refinement of functional specifications for ERP, Business Intelligence and related system changes. The Business Analyst reports directly to the Business Specialist, Strategic Performance and Client management. Your responsibilities The Business Analyst will assist the supervisor, the Business Specialist P3 in the in the provision of financial monitoring, analysis and reporting services in respect of services clustered in GSSU. In particular the Business Analyst will undertake the following duties;  Assists the development of extracts, reports and dashboards in respect of GSSU services. Ensure that all extracts, reports, dashboards or other inputs have been appropriately tested and that data integrity is maintained with auditable corporate reports.  Assists the management and guidance of business area users in developing solutions for their reporting and information needs as well as identifying new data needs and delivery mechanisms for reporting information.  Assists to ensure system integrity through running his/her own checks and diagnostics, and through the creation of processes to run defined queries on a regular basis.  Assists the design and development of functional specifications required by GSSU and GSSU clients, through reviewing and refining functional specifications where necessary.  Assists to communicate clearly and openly with the Service delivery teams and with GSSC clients, based on facts. Ensure client priorities and constraints are well understood and supported.  Core Competencies: Innovation - Ability to make new and useful ideas work.  Leadership - Ability to persuade others to follow.  People Management - Ability to improve performance and satisfaction.  Communication - Ability to listen, adapt, persuade and transform.  Delivery - Ability to get things done while exercising good judgement.  Technical/Functional: Financial Reporting and Analysis Ability to evaluate financial data, derive relevant findings and present them in a meaningful manner.  Audit Ability to examine and verify accounts and records.  Accounting (General) Knowledge of accounting concepts, principles, regulations, and policies and ability to apply to strategic and/or practical situations.  Financial Planning and Budgeting Ability to create and manage processes to achieve UNDP's long and short-term financial goals.  Functional Technical Knowledge Firm understanding of business intelligence tools, and the architecture and design of advanced integrated management systems,preferably including PeopleSoft.  Knowledge Management Ability to efficiently handle and share information and knowledge.  Operational Efficiency Ability to identify and execute opportunities to improve operational efficiency.  Problem Solving Accurately accumulating information and its analysis; forecasting potential problems and planning; allowing for alternative, creative solutions and identifying most reasonable solutions. You will have  University Master in Finance or Accounting desirable or Professional Accounting Qualification i.e. ACCA/CPA/etc.  Up to 2 years of relevant experience in business or finance and business intelligence and analysis.  Experience in managing and supporting clients.  Experience in the usage of computers and MS Office packages.  Advanced knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages.  Experience in handling Client Relationship Management (CRM) applications or business analytics systems is desirable.  Hands-on experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), preferably with ATLAS (PeopleSoft).  Fluency in English. Knowledge of any other UN languages (French/Spanish/Arabic) is a plus.  Others: Hands-on proficiency with SQL, BI tools, Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) preferred.  Experience in production of Financial Reports and data management preferred.  Experience in handling of web-based management systems desirable. Business Intelligence Manager (Chemicals Team) Global Commercial & Business Development Internal applicant: Please be reminded to speak to your current manager before applying. This position is responsible for leading a team of analysts that conducts worldwide product and market research, develops opinions for commercial, sales and business development projects and undertakes management reporting. Key products to be covered are chemicals, gases, veg oil / bio fuels and base oils. Position reports to the Global Chemicals Director. Responsibilities: Undertake Research to Acquire Product and Market Intelligence Keeps abreast of market trends in chemicals, LPG/chemical Gases, veg oil and base oil products in a timely manner Examines those market trends and develops opinion on customers/products to benefit from changing market or customer conditions Understands key features of petchem complexes and clusters from a feedstock, product and derivative perspective and resulting market developments Generates and communicates market intel to all divisions in a well-timed manner through appropriate well written reporting structures. Develops and maintains relationships with key internal stakeholders to identify emerging needs and business challenges. Works with internal stakeholders across functions and time zones to enhance their strategic analysis and market and competitor intelligence. Oversees a team of two analysts who conduct similar work to support the overall targets of the Global Chemicals Product Team. Conduct Market Studies Takes lead role in scoping and conducting (or supporting) market studies for Divisions and Opcos Coordinates with internal or external parties to meet the objectives of the study scope Maintains lead role in external relationship with key chemicals / gases product consultants (eg IHSMarkit, ICIS, Nexant, Argus, WoodMac, FGH, etc). Maintains a healthy relationships with external product specialists worldwide to support the requirements of all divisions/opcos. Delivers high quality study results, which are beneficial to the company in taking decisions for commercial, business development and account management objectives Supports analysts in other divisions from a functional aspect and takes lead in their networking across the company. Initiates discussion, challenges and influences strategic management decision making and identifies opportunities for growth. Write and Manage Reporting Activities Acts as primary originator of product and market reports from a GC Team perspective supported by analysts Takes lead responsibility in developing / managing all routine and scheduled reporting activities worldwide, including EB/SB, global newsletters, divisional product information, presentations, opinions on SIP/FIP business cases, etc. Coordinates with other product analyst teams eg Oil, LNG, etc. Coordinates with other global corporate functions such as finance, corporate communications, operations and technology, new ventures, new energies, etc. Prepares written reports and presentations of findings, illustrating data graphically, and making complex matters/findings insightful. Support Business Development Activities Supports BD projects in building a business case for products and markets in scope. Conducts investigations for port and site analysis, with a view to create an opinion on the viability of the location. Assists in coordinating market intel with consultants and product specialists when needed. Supports project teams in developing write-ups for SIP/FIP or tender submissions. Translates complex findings into actionable recommendations. Requirements: Bachelor's degree (technical/engineering or business/economics); Minimum of 5-7 years commercial and business development experience in the petrochemical sector or an associated oil and gas industry, and business intelligence experience an added advantage. Knowledge of petrochemical products/markets and ability to investigate developments that lead to demand / supply changes. Skills to conduct market research, manage large data. Ability to quickly learn and develop new concepts and technologies. Positive stakeholder management capabilities with strong communication skills. Excellent writing and ability to generate detailed reports. Capability to develop own opinion on key developments, and be able to influence others. Be able to handle multiple study projects concurrently, in different products and geographies, and work the time zones effectively. Leadership to manage own team, as well as work with divisional team members, to prioritize and conduct market research effectively. What we offer: Every career at Vopak is given the opportunity to shine! When you join Vopak, you can count on: A challenging position with a high degree of responsibility in a Dutch multinational with a history over 400 years; Highly motivated colleagues; Room to grow through professional training and personal development opportunities at national and international level.

Job Title: Cloud Intelligence BD Technical Lead - APJ
Job Description: 5-10 years of pre-sales, solution engineering, solution architecture experience Deep understanding of technical aspects of cloud computing with Technical Certification on AWS (or other cloud technology platform) Strong communication skills (verbal/written) and should have attention to detail. Must enjoy working in a highly collaborative, fast paced environment, and possess outstanding interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges  Are you comfortable in conducting assessment of product features in detail and contextualizing this to drive enhanced customer outcomes? Can you take complex scenarios and simplify them down to the essentials, crafting an elegant approach that drives customer adoption and revenue growth?  You will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy for using competitive intelligence and specifically technical insights to programmatically scale AWS??s cloud computing business. Your responsibilities will include supporting the AWS APAC Competitive Intelligence lead, and field teams on customer and partner engagements to win competitive deals. You will serve as an expert resource on competitive intelligence of cloud, IT applications and infrastructures, working with our customers and field teams, helping them understand the benefits of migrating to AWS, articulate technical differentiators of AWS versus competition while contextualizing the business impact for the customer.  You will synthesize data and information as it relates to functional comparison and key differentiators from intelligence gathering and customer engagements into succinct findings and persuasively communicate findings and perspectives to APAC Competitive Intelligence lead and eventually to Sales and Service teams. The ideal candidate will possess a technical and business background that enables them to drive engagements and communicate the benefits of AWS to IT architects, engineering teams and C-Level executives. You should have demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the complex business and technical needs of customers. You should also have detailed knowledge and a strong technical understanding of cloud concepts and vendors in general, and AWS specifically.  Roles & Responsibilities Serve as a key member of the APAC Competitive Intelligence Business Development team in helping to drive AWS engagements with our customers and partners. Understand the business and technical requirements of our customers and partners and determine how their needs can best be met by AWS. Address customer questions or concerns about feature and functional comparison of AWS, as compared to other vendors in the market Serve as a central resource for the Sales team to help proactively educate our customers on the benefits of AWS cloud platform Work closely with the APAC Competitive Intelligence lead and field teams to drive closure on our highest priority opportunities in the pipeline. Create a repository of Competitive Intelligence cases studies and best practice collaterals to share learnings with all parts of AWS Serve as a key source of market insights into how our customers view the benefits of using AWS relative to the broader Cloud Computing market Handle a high volume of engagements and fast pace of the cloud computing market  Demonstrated experience developing enterprise application architectures to meet business requirements in complex environments 5+ years in customer-facing roles Multiple cloud technical platform certifications Demonstrated ability to synthesize large amounts of information into actionable insights and crisp presentations. `Strong analytic skills, demonstrated track record of harnessing data to drive decision making.

Job Title: Software Engineer, Full Stack (Business Intelligence Product...
Job Description: CSIT develops products to advance the national security interests of Singapore. Our products are used in a wide range of operations, including but not limited to Counter-terrorism and Computer Network Defence. We are looking for talented software engineers to build mission-critical products that identify, analyse and disrupt threats. Role CSIT IT's product team builds robust web applications and data platforms to enable our users to analyse and use their data to improve operations and decision-making. We develop a wide spectrum of systems from interactive visualization tools (charting, relationships, geospatial, etc), complex data platforms to intelligent search engine. Besides delivering feature-rich systems, our team focuses on building systems for humans by emphasizing on user experience and automation. As a full stack engineer, you will be part of the team engaged in full stack development of product features involving building delightful front-end experience as per our design specifications to building microservices and designing data stores for the backend. We are looking for highly skilled multi-talented Software Engineers who can bring fresh ideas from all areas, including web development, information retrieval, system design, network design, implementing natural language processing and UI design. To sum up, your job is beyond coding, you are here solve problems and figure out the best way to build systems with us! In a rapidly changing technological world, we embrace a culture of continuous learning and self-development. This job role will also require you to actively learn and share knowledge on new architectures, frameworks and technologies. We are seeking people who are experienced in full-stack development and share an interest for tackling complexity and building systems in a fast-paced environment to join our product team! Responsibilities Collaborate with Product Managers, UX engineers and other Software Engineers to deliver compelling user-facing products Develop prototype Write and create robust production-grade web applications and services Learn and share knowledge in a multi-disciplinary team and with fellow passionate engineers Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale back-end services Architect efficient and reusable services and applications Support applications and systems developed by the team Requirements Minimum qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information System or related field (Fresh graduates are welcome) As full stack engineers we work with a wide spectrum of languages, framework and tools. We need the applicant to possess fundamental knowledge in all areas listed below (ability to explain how each area works). However, we do not require high proficiency in all areas. High proficiency in at least two of the following areas and the ability to learn is what matters to us Front end languages such as HTML, CSS, Less and JavaScript JavaScript frameworks such as React, Redux, NodeJS and VueJS Java web services framework such as Springboot and Spark Search engines such as Elasticsearch and Solr Database technologies such as SQL, NoSQL and GraphDB Infrastructure provision, orchestration and other tools such as Docker, K8s, RabbitMQ and Nginx Experience in building web applications Nice-to-haves Experience in building large-scale and complex web applications Familiarity with DevOps practices As CSIT is an agency under the Ministry of Defence (Singapore), only Singapore Citizens will be considered.

Job Description: As the research and analysis division of the Economist Group, The Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) helps leaders prepare for opportunity, empowering them to act with confidence when making strategic decisions. The EIU is the global standard in providing quality, actionable intelligence to the public and private sector, assessing issues that impact the marketplace for over two hundred countries.  The holder of this role leads and directs the Country Analysis Asia team. The holder of this role is an intellectual leader of the EIU, making sure that the quality of the analysis produced by the editorial team meets the standards expected of Economist Group products and services and meets the needs of our clients by addressing the economic, political, industry and business issues of the day in a timely and relevant manner. The holder of this role is also a thought leader, representing The EIU externally at the most senior level, both to clients, prospects and the media.  Accountabilities How you will contribute: To be an intellectual leader within The EIU and to deliver the regional analysis for the Asia region To work collaboratively with other senior EIU staff members to support new initiatives To manage the Asia team effectively and to attract and develop high calibre staff To contribute to the commercial success of the Country Analysis business To preserve the integrity of the Economist brand in line with its founding principles To ensure that the quality of our editorial output, both written and numerical, meets the high standards expected by our clients. To proactively make whatever changes are necessary to support this objective Have a strong external profile, possessing excellent presentation skills and an ability to work effectively in a public forum Managing a cost budget associated with the teams (including contributor costs and travel costs) The ideal skills for this role are: Experience in managing an editorial operation in an international environment Experience in producing economic forecasts and analysis on both developed and emerging economies Strong editorial skills Experience of working collaboratively with other senior stakeholders and balancing their competing requirements Broad knowledge of political and economic trends A proven ability to convey ideas and opinions coherently and with authority A willingness to develop your external profile in a manner that aligns with our commercial goals The ability to build positive relationships across the editorial team and the wider business, and works co-operatively to ensure the best overall result for the EIU Strong leadership skills - an ability to inspire and motivate individuals, but also to build and shape teams so they can deliver on business objectives The ability to be an intellectual leader within The EIU and to have a strong external profile

Job Category Sales Job Details ASEAN Sales Strategy Analyst Singapore, Singapore About the Position: The Analyst will play a critical role in the ASEAN Sales Strategy team. This person will be accountable for identifying and reporting on key indicators of sales performance and market opportunity, using those findings to set the strategic agenda for the sales group, and presenting recommendations to senior leaders. The analyst will own the analytical infrastructure for a pillar of the ASEAN Sales business and projects will include business planning, market segmentation, pipeline analysis, coverage optimization, and ongoing performance measurement. Job Description: About Nautilus. Nautilus is building artificial intelligence to advance the efficiency of ocean commerce. We deliver technology to help shipping companies minimize fuel consumption, maximize operational efficiency, and optimize fleet performance. By arming ship owners and operators with real-time predictive decision support, Nautilus is reducing greenhouse gas emissions and making global trade sustainable. Ocean shipping consumes over $100 billion dollars of fuel every year, and up to 30% of it can be saved. For owner-operators, reliance on manually collected and analyzed data makes it difficult to optimize fleet performance in real-time. By providing a unified data platform that leverages machine learning, Nautilus helps its clients make better decisions to maximize the return on each ship and every voyage. For our clients, this means they drive closer collaboration, greater transparency, and stronger accountability across their global teams every day. About You. You are an experienced seller, who is empathetic, technically-minded, and analytical with expertise in technology sales throughout the APAC region. You can easily build, or already have, the professional relationships required to successfully build and maintain a strong book of business in the ocean shipping industry. And since you will be our first sales hire in Singapore, joining a small and growing team, you will also need to be a self-starter, and comfortable working remotely from the larger team (predominantly based in NYC today). This role requires experience with a consultative selling approach, requiring a robust discovery into client workflows and processes in order to quantify the value of Nautilus Platform. The ideal candidate has a track record of helping clients quantify return on investment from software and building business cases to justify an investment in technology. You are able to build trust, eloquently negotiate contract terms, understand client points of view, adapt to change, and promote new opportunities for clients to realize return on their Nautilus usage. To start, this means being a rockstar individual contributor, who is not afraid to roll up her/his sleeves, get creative, and find innovative and personalized ways to secure meetings with new prospective clients. Long-term, this means having the passion and desire to exceed sales targets, develop deep trusted relationships with our clients, and coach up and mentor new members of the Sales team in Singapore as we grow. While you will have clear KPIs focused on securing and growing revenue streams, you will collaborate closely with Client Success, Business Development, and Product, in order to ensure the long-term success of the clients that you bring onto Nautilus Platform. As a Client Executive you have at least 10 years of experience working in a quota-carrying sales role, preferably selling to enterprise clients with dynamic procurement processes and multi-stakeholder deal cycles. Outcomes For This Role. Build a robust opportunity pipeline with qualified buyers. Manage sales cycle from initial outreach to post-kickoff. Exceed sales quota. Deeply understand product use cases, client organizations/workflows, and own product demonstrations that portray high ROI to customers. Establish trust and credibility - externally and internally - to act as a primary feedback loop from the market to Nautilus. Proficiencies. You have sold to Enterprise clients in a closing role for 6+ years, and have been in a prospecting-driven sales role for 10+ years. Prior experience and deep belief in data-driven sales methodologies. Passionate about and adept at rapidly learning about a new industry - you??re intellectually curious! Strong written and verbal communication skills to generate client-facing content and dialogue. Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to attain key metrics and targets. Results-driven strategic thinker who is able to thrive in an unstructured and fast-paced environment. Experience up-selling/cross-selling new products within an existing customer base Passionate about our mission and in changing the way a massive industry works Personable, collaborative, thoughtful, empathetic, tenacious, with a sense of humor Preferred Skills And Experience. Prior experience (4+ years) working at early-stage or growth-stage SaaS startups Prior experience (4+ years) in solution selling data/analytics tools to and/or working in the maritime industry with ocean shipping businesses. Our Core Values. Get ready to join a group of diverse, smart, talented, and driven individuals. We are looking for people who are motivated by environmentalism and a future where shipping is sustainable and safe. A team member joining Nautilus is... We??re THOUGHTFUL, with a bias towards action. We??re an INCLUSIVE crew, and we are not passengers along for the ride. We??re DIRECT and we ask the tough questions. We EMPATHIZE with humanity. Must Be Eligible To Work In Singapore We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  You may apply directly on our website: https://boards.greenhouse.io/nautiluslabs/jobs/4948779002?gh_jid=4948779002

Job Title: Commercial Director, Singapore & Indonesia Department: Water Quality Platform Reports To: General Manager, Water Quality Platform Position Location: Singapore  Danaher Corporation is an $ 20 billion company that designs, manufactures and markets products and services with strong brand names, proprietary technologies and major market positions. Job Description: This is an opportunity to play an impactful and integral role within the NMG Consulting finance team, working closely with the Finance Manager in Singapore and key stakeholders globally to manage the revenue and expense reporting for each Business Unit. Company Overview NMG Consulting is a leading multinational insurance, reinsurance and investments consultancy, integrating consulting, insights and analytics. Our consultants provide strategy consulting, insights, analytics and actuarial services to financial institutions including banks, insurers, reinsurers and fund managers. We are constantly evolving and the range of work that we do challenges and expands our peoples?? knowledge at lightning speed. Our flat, team-based structures encourage participation from all experience levels ?? everyone is encouraged to contribute, regardless of their role. We advocate hearing different points of view, collaboration and constructive debate. Summary Statement This is an opportunity to play an impactful and integral role within the NMG Consulting finance team, working closely with the Finance Manager in Singapore and key stakeholders globally to manage the revenue and expense reporting for each Business Unit. In this position, you will ensure control, accuracy and predictability in the reporting of financial results, working closely with business unit leaders to run comparative analysis and provide input and accompanying commentary. The position will require the incumbent to quickly develop an understanding of each Business Units operations, as well as the economic and market drivers that may impact Businesses performance against forecast. You will anticipate changes in forecasts and identify practical and innovative improvements to support business intelligence and enable stronger and effective decision making. This position will suit a self-motivated individual who possesses strong technical skills and can work well within a small finance team. A positive and enthusiastic approach is essential, along with the ability to converse successfully with colleagues at all levels, including senior management. Role Financial Controller (Support) Location: Singapore Industry: Insurance, Reinsurance Join Us Key Responsibilities Preparation of monthly management reports and key performance indicators; overseeing month-end account close; proactively identifying issues, trends and commenting on performance against forecast; Undertaking cash flow management/forecasting Liaison with internal stakeholders, external auditors and tax agents on reporting requirements; analysing financial risks within each Business Unit and across the Company, proposing solutions where a problem is identified; preparing, presenting and analysing financial budgets and plans Overseeing of financial processes, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements and group policies and procedures; conducting regular reviews of business processes, identify improvements Coaching and mentoring junior accounting staff Supporting ad-hoc projects, as required Competencies, Qualifications & Experience Degree qualified in Accountancy or Finance; audit / Big 4 experience preferred Strong time management skills; able to meet tight deadlines and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment Strong written, communication and interpersonal skills Ability to proactively deal with senior management; team player; strong leadership skills Positive & enthusiastic approach; highly independent and motivated

Job Description  The Corporate Sales Executive will focus on corporate customer acquisition, lead generation and prospect management, as this role will garner and meet with potential clients. The corporate sales executive will also research on corporate business referral and new leads; provide customers/clients with all services offered and additional presentation as needed; and work with clients to create solutions for their needs and consult throughout the sales process. The successful candidate must be energetic, well-spoken, good with numbers, eager to close sales and increase revenue. He/she must also be a self-starter and problem solver, comfortable in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and be able to pay careful attention to details.  Job Responsibilities Corporate Sales Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options Sells products by establishing contact and developing relationships with prospects; recommending solutions. Reaching out to new customers and making presentations or pitches outlining the benefits of product/ services Understanding the client requirements and then customizing the product/ services as per their needs Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements for bulk/repeated purchase/ bespoke programs Ensuring proper servicing and after sales support to client E-commerce Platform Sales (Tangs, EAmart in addition to Lazada, Qoo10, Shopee etc) Develop promotions and execute the e-commerce platform business plan and calendar of activities to increase conversion and drive basket size Configure and update product listing and promotion mechanics across the various e-commerce platforms and update content accurately and in a timely manner Perform regular competitor analysis to generate new ideas, increase market intelligence and to determine price points for listing Manage all fulfilment of sales orders on E-commerce Platforms Ensuring personal sales target are met monthly Monthly data reporting on sales figure to management Explore new sales opportunity in other online market places Inventory Accountability, Payment and paperwork related matters Ensure proper accountability for all inventory Ensure proper follow up on all administrative and payment related matters Job Requirements Good written and verbal communication skills Strong negotiation skills Creative talents and the logical ability to solve tough problems (understand and respond to client??s needs) Good understanding of sales cycle and sales techniques Excellent time management and organisation Skill in prioritizing Attention to detail Socially adept ?? an outgoing and likeable personality Confidence in your own abilities A high degree of self-motivation A passion for selling and relationship building Resilience and persistence Sales Driven and results & numbers orientated

The APAC Long-term Forecasting Analyst will report to the Planning Leader for EMEA & APAC. The individual will be responsible for creating long-term forecasts that derive from the understood business drivers to determine required headcount based on projecting volumes, duration, and required staffing levels using current trends and historical data for multiple contact types as well as initiative roadmaps. Close collaboration with other function within WFM/WFP team to support the execution of plans.  Defining long term projections across multiple Global markets, segments and functions under-scored by robust baseline data, in addition to factoring in new and upcoming initiatives and intelligence that will impact HC requirement. Help ensure responsibility for high quality baseline demand forecasts that are developed and maintained for Operations, leveraging statistical analysis and expertise with the best available cross-functional inputs and applying sound judgment based on knowledge of the business. Developing and analysing data with the objective of making recommendations for adjusting staffing levels to meeting departmental productivity and SL objectives, with an ability to reconcile information from diverse sources into a single unified statement of demand Navigating data and other various obstacles to deliver required forecasts and insights Owning the forecasting process, assuring proper delivery, consistency, and accuracy of forecast deliverables and outputs, gathering information from multiple sources as well as having a strong business acumen Working with key stakeholders to ensure forecast accuracy is met and deadlines are achieved, particularly in relation to the monthly Headcount Planning process Building credibility, establishing rapport, and maintaining communication with stakeholders at multiple levels within a matrix based organization. Working and partnering with other members of the WFM teams in forecasting and scheduling as well as WFP in delivery an end to end approach to HC planning and management. Continuously seeking opportunities to streamline and enhance current processes Attending APAC weekly site meetings and other WFM scheduled meetings, providing contribution and input Participating in other duties as assigned

The Regional Demand Planner works closely with the business at country and regional levels to ensure that all available sales, market, and marketing intelligence is incorporated in the unit projection, including the uncertainty and risks associated with potential business or orders. As part of the S&OP process, the Regional Planner leads or co-leads the Demand Supply Integrated Reconciliation meeting with the key Business (Marketing /Sales) and Finance stakeholders to validate and reconcile the unit forecast and constraint supply with the financial projections. The Regional Planner represents the region in Global S&OP - ensures timely collection and review of the appropriate information required for this forum Job Description Regional Demand Management: Responsible for the Regional Demand Figures which indirectly drive the production planning, and directly affecting the availability of inventory to customers. Works with Marketing/ Product Managers, Finance and Supply Planning to understand the impact of the forecast, the financial gaps, potential risk and opportunities. Works closely with Country Demand Planners, provides guidance and coordination in key areas of Demand Planning processes to ensure consistency and high performance. Facilitates the Regional Demand Review, leads the aggregation of regional demand for the Businesses and provide timely information to all the relevant processes (both Regional & WW S&OP forums). Plays an active role in translating the key element of the business strategies into tactical functional initiatives to meet the service and objectives across all regions. As the owner of the Regional Demand Planning Process for the Businesses, he or she will be responsible for leading and coordinating the monthly Regional Integrated Reconciliation meeting by actively engaging the Marketing and Finance community as key participants in the process. Actively contributes and supports the development and implementation of the Regional Business Strategy in the Demand Planning functional area. Represents the region in the WW Demand Review - ensure timely collection and review of the appropriate information required for this forum Initiates and drives improvements in the process through increased market knowledge and systems usage. Focuses on improvements in demand modeling, statistical forecasting, which drives greater accuracy and is directly linked to increased customer service and inventory strategies. Maintains a strong link to business activity and global issues as they may affect respective products. Responsible for coordination of the demand for the annual long-term planning process. Consolidate, challenge the country LTP input as well as provide Regional input Back Order & Manual Allocation Owns and establishes the manual allocation process in the event of chronic supply shortage. Work with Fulfillment/ Supply planner to manage the allocation process based on agreed priorities. Work with the fulfillment/ supply planners on any supply chain or manufacturing initiatives that may impact the supply. Planning strategies Work closely with Fulfillment/ Supply planning to establish planning strategies & inventory policy to meet business objectives and the targeted service levels. Conduct periodic review on system planning parameters jointly with Fulfillment/ Supply planning to support the strategies. Key Supply Chain Operations Metrics Accountable on achieving targeted supply chain operation metrics, Forecast Accuracy, Back Order, Line Fine Rate, Inventory for respective WWB assigned. Ability to set targets and establish plans to drive metric improvement to target at regional level Others Ensures all S&OP documentation is completed on a timely basis to meet APEX requirements. Ensures process executions are in compliance with Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) & other regulatory requirements e.g. GDPMDS Performs any other tasks as assigned Requirements Education: Degree in Supply chain/ Business / Logistics / Economics Relevant Experience: Min 4 years of Demand planning /Inventory management experience APO and SAP knowledge Advanced MS Excel skill Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Skilled at influence without authorities Business and customer oriented and a good team player Functional (Knowledge) Demand Planning & Analysis Customer & Market knowledge Sales & Operational Planning Strategic Planning/ Network design (SC Modeling & Optimization) Metrics Functional (Skills) Proficient in driving region S&OP and represent region in WW S&OP meetings. Has understanding of the E2E Supply Chain and the Regional Networks Strong Analytical Skills, Capable to drill-down for root cause analysis, linked to capability to synthesize and translate findings into business language Working knowledge of Project Mgmt and CI tools Primary Work Location SGP The Strategy Additional Locations Work Shift SG Normal Office 0900-1800 (Singapore)

Job Description: Job Summary   There are three main businesses within the company: Brand & Advertising, Experience, and PR & Influence. Our Company??s growth is dependent on the depth and breadth of these capabilities and the client solutions they ultimately provides.     The Head of Experience is therefore a critical business development role, with the responsibility of growing the Experience business within the Vietnam office and on each client. This includes strategies and execution that touch on all aspects of our clients?? experience including digital transformation, acquisition and performance, CRM and loyalty, ecommerce, digital product and social media.     This is a business role, so will require client growth and resource planning, in addition to having a strategic point of view on the client work. There will be considerable new business/pitching, reflecting both the market dynamics and our ambition for this capability to grow at speed.     The Head of Experience will be continually driven to learn new skills, keep abreast of changing technologies and be continually finessing and fine-tuning experience strategies, persona and journey, engagement ideas, acquisition plans, loyalty programs, ecosystem design and plans to unlock total customer value. With the rapid growth of ecommerce and shopping platforms, this role will also help develop a clear value proposition and services to manage commerce for our clients, working closely with key staff to leverage our network intelligence.     The successful candidate will work to connect the different components of the company's consulting, strategy and client teams, along with our MarTech CoE, to provide client solutions.     With 12+yrs related industry (consulting, digital agency) experience, the successful candidate can hold court with C-level clients and navigate all levels of client relationships and partnerships to make great work happen, namely the creative transformation of our clients?? businesses. Experience in performance marketing and the activation of customer data will be highly valuable. Required to be based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.     Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities   Client Management    Working with the management team to establish an assessment and an action plan for the growth of Experience services and products across key clients within the Vietnam office.  Continue to build the Experience practice within the Vietnam office developing a holistic approach to further enable the already established capabilities of UX, Tech and Data to drive growth.  Develop a pipeline of clients and prospects and create a focus list working both directly as a capability and closely with integrated client leaders.  Create ??provocations?? and ??sell?? sessions with existing and new clients to better explain services and to build credibility, relationship and to convert projects.    Capability Leadership    The growth of specialist Experience services: strategies and execution that touch on all aspects of our clients?? experience including digital transformation, acquisition and performance, CRM and loyalty, ecommerce, digital product and social media. Some services are established already; for others, such as acquisition/performance and ecommerce, the successful candidate will have a mandate to build this offering.  Articulate critical client problems around engagement planning and develop solutions based on category understanding, client capability, competitive landscape, cultural tension, and customer insights  Ability to adopt, customize global platform (Salesforce, Adobe etc) and solutions for client engagement.  Drive ecommerce growth across Vietnam; either through brand.com or market-place activation initiatives, ensuring the solution matches the nuance requirement particular to Vietnam.  Develop engagement ideas and craft experiences that are customer-centric, value-driven, and creatively-inspiring, driving a client??s business ambition and customer value opportunity based on market-sizing, customer value estimates, and macro trend analysis  Bring the strategic idea to life, defining clear roles for different content / media and integrating them to drive measurable results  Elevate the standard of effectiveness and creativity through pursue of high quality work, on-job training to teams, case writing, and collaboration with different business units across whole company    Leadership & People Management    Lead a team of Experience practitioners and closely collaborate with other capabilities in all offices to establish best practice for all project needs  Manage, motivate, and coach team members to continuously sharpen core strategy skills, develop learning and training plans, to become a strong capability team  Collaborate with leadership and play an active role in talent identification, acquisition, development, and retention  Act as a thought leader in representing The Company 's expertise in Customer Experience including speaking at industry events, driving case studies, writing POV / white papers, and refreshing our service offerings    Creativity    A differentiating factor of the company in this digital space is its ability to bring creativity and brand thinking to all channels. It is for this reason the Head of Experience is expected to ??lean in? to brand conversations and to retain a constant curiosity for all things creative, in addition to your thought leadership when it comes to Experience.    Reporting & KPI    The services within the Experience are measured regularly. A CAGR growth target will be created in consultation with the successful candidate and office/regional leadership    The Role reports to Vietnam Office CEO and SEA Experience leadership  Bachelor's / Honours, Masters / PhD

Job Description: Rakuten is Japan's leading Internet services company, a largest e-commerce company in Japan, and the third largest e-commerce marketplace worldwide with a combined membership of almost 1.3 billion. Rakuten has 70+ businesses and services spread across 30 countries and regions worldwide. Rakuten is an Eco-system of online services, providing a variety of consumer and business-focused services including e-commerce, e-reading, travel, banking, securities, credit card, e-money, portal and media, online marketing and professional sports.  At Rakuten Viki, a premier global entertainment streaming site where millions of people discover and consume primetime shows and movies subtitled in more than 200 languages, by our community of fans. With billions of videos viewed and more than 1 billion words translated, Viki brings global entertainment to fans everywhere!  Soompi, also part of Rakuten Viki, is one of the biggest global K-pop news sites and the longest-running fandom community. From innovative engagement features to original content and social shopping, Rakuten Viki and Soompi are pushing the boundaries of user engagement and social viewing.  At Rakuten Viki, our engineering teams utilize leading-edge technologies to build a world class product. You will join a diverse and talented team with great ambitions to change the digital entertainment landscape. We are looking for top talent across APAC to join our Data Analytics team as a Data Analyst. If you are inspired to take up new challenges then come be a part of our Rakuten Viki team in Singapore.  Viki is seeking an experienced Data Analyst for our Data Analytics Team. At Viki, we handle terabytes of data to help us understand our users and learn about content trends. Our analytics team is first and foremost responsible for collecting, processing and organizing these large amounts of data using advanced and scalable techniques. They then analyze these complex datasets to generate deeper insights and help various teams at Viki effectively utilize it for crucial decision making. This person will play a key role in advancing analytics at Viki, performing in-depth analyses to improve business metrics and building data-driven models to support business decision making.  Responsibilities: Deep dive into big data and provide business intelligence and analytics support to key company-wide business initiatives Develop insights through reports and dashboards for Product and business functions to inform product ideation and business decision. Work with Product Managers to formulate and analyse A/B testing experiments Manage Data quality and lifecycle for assigned feature area including validating data integrity, and working with engineers to ensure necessary correction Conduct inferential analysis and predictive analysis to model user behaviour and relevant metrics  Qualifications: BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related discipline with 4-8 years of relevant work experience Outstanding quantitative and analytical skills Highly proficient in writing complex SQL queries Deep understanding of the usage and interpretation of statistical methods Interest in large scale data mining, gathering insights and reporting Prior experience with the following languages/tools is highly preferred: For data modeling: R, Python For data processing: Hadoop, MapReduce, Kafka, Redshift, BigQuery, Spark For data visualization: Looker, Amplitude, Tableau, Qlikview, Holistics  Rakuten is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged.

As the research and analysis division of the Economist Group, The Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) helps leaders prepare for opportunity, empowering them to act with confidence when making strategic decisions. The EIU is the global standard in providing quality, actionable intelligence to the public and private sector, assessing issues that impact the marketplace for over two hundred countries.  The holder of this role leads and directs the Country Analysis Asia team. The holder of this role is an intellectual leader of the EIU, making sure that the quality of the analysis produced by the editorial team meets the standards expected of Economist Group products and services and meets the needs of our clients by addressing the economic, political, industry and business issues of the day in a timely and relevant manner. The holder of this role is also a thought leader, representing The EIU externally at the most senior level, both to clients, prospects and the media.  Accountabilities How you will contribute: To be an intellectual leader within The EIU and to deliver the regional analysis for the Asia region To work collaboratively with other senior EIU staff members to support new initiatives To manage the Asia team effectively and to attract and develop high calibre staff To contribute to the commercial success of the Country Analysis business To preserve the integrity of the Economist brand in line with its founding principles To ensure that the quality of our editorial output, both written and numerical, meets the high standards expected by our clients. To proactively make whatever changes are necessary to support this objective Have a strong external profile, possessing excellent presentation skills and an ability to work effectively in a public forum Managing a cost budget associated with the teams (including contributor costs and travel costs) The ideal skills for this role are: Experience in managing an editorial operation in an international environment Experience in producing economic forecasts and analysis on both developed and emerging economies Strong editorial skills Experience of working collaboratively with other senior stakeholders and balancing their competing requirements Broad knowledge of political and economic trends A proven ability to convey ideas and opinions coherently and with authority A willingness to develop your external profile in a manner that aligns with our commercial goals The ability to build positive relationships across the editorial team and the wider business, and works co-operatively to ensure the best overall result for the EIU Strong leadership skills - an ability to inspire and motivate individuals, but also to build and shape teams so they can deliver on business objectives The ability to be an intellectual leader within The EIU and to have a strong external profile
